description:
Have been coming here for years. The owners are super sweet and accommodating. It's a great neighborhood sushi spot that's family friendly. They have a broad menu for such a small place and some interesting unique items too.

They also have a great happy hour menu before 6pm on weekdays.

Highly recommend the hamachi carpacio if you like a little spice, tempura (breaded well, not too thick), and the 10 piece omakase is a pretty good deal.
author: Sharon L.

description:
After eating here probably 5 times, and getting takeout another 5, I took my 3 year old here for lunch today and while our food was good, our server treated us so strangely that we will never be returning.

Several weird things:

1) Gave my daughter a menu, then 5 seconds later took it away from her, and didn't even realize that she was saying "I want the menu" as he walked away.

2) Took away her chopsticks. And after I grabbed her new ones, he came over and tried to scare me that she'd get lots of splinters from them and get hurt sticking them in her nose or eyes. Um, maybe this is a problem for some kids, but you're not her dad, and my daughter is actually a sushi pro at this point. She actually uses her chopsticks and it's one of the things she loves about eating sushi.

3) Sat us at a sticky table, and when we moved, chastised us for moving without asking for permission. He explained that it's sticky just because it's old... But the table we moved to wasn't sticky. So why did he sit us at the sticky table to begin with? When your restaurant is empty, maybe use the good tables first?

4) Bought two lunch specials, each with salad, but only brought out one salad. Why?

5) We asked if they had any juice. His answer was simply "No". Not "No, sorry, but we do have x, y, z...". Just "No".

6) We had to share a soy sauce dish. Because apparently kids don't like soy sauce? Or deserve their own dish?

7) Never came by to check how we were doing... We needed plates to actually eat on. I had to get up and go ask for one.

BTW it's not like anyone was watching, but my daughter ate all of our nigiri, all of our gyoza, half of our rice, half of our maki, plus some of her soup and tempura. For a little one, she chowed down. Sushi is her favorite food. It's what she always asks for when I ask her what she wants.

I do think this is a fine place for mid-range sushi if you're a group of friends or a couple. The quality of the food is quite good. Before I had kids, I really liked coming here. But now that I do have kids, I don't think this place is a good fit.
author: Jon E.

description:
Nice restaurant which really felt authentic due all the Japanese customers there.  Situated at the back, next to Miyako hotel, a quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of the mall. I had moments when I felt I was in Japan and we were the only non Japanese customers there.  The waitress was super hospitable. The food was good....the miso ramen was simple and a little on the salty side for me.  The tempura roll was on par and really crispy on the inside. The Chirashi bowl was simple and satisfying.
A great place for authentic Japanese food and atmosphere.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Exellent sushi experience! We loved every single thing we ordered. Great service, very chill  ambience. Numerous menu offerings and specials. I like that they tell you where the fish is from. My favorite thing we ordered was the Tai Carpaccio. I think that I could eat that everyday. Great balance of flavors and attention to detail on every plate. 
I already want to come back to try everything else before we go back to Oregon!
author: Stacy M.

description: I tried both dine in and delivery service a couple times. It surprises me that the two were completely oppositely in quality. Dine in service is great- prompt, quick and no mess, but the delivery service terribly slow, comes late always and some time misses our orders. I believe they can do better on the delivery service. 3 stars for now!
author: Erich B.

description:
Hiding in plain sight, I've easily walked past Takara Sushi 150 times and finally just learned that they're open for lunch.  People are constantly asking me where to go for lunch in the Castro and now that I know that Takara serves it, I've added it to my list of suggestions.  

If you're in the Castro, seeking well-priced Japanese food for lunch, here's your place.

I understand that Takara does a bustling business at night which might account for the tired look of it during mid-day.  The tables were worn and the place looked bleak enough that I had a moment of hesitation on whether I really wanted to try their raw fish.  The moment passed, I overlooked the interior, ordered, and crossed my fingers.

Trust.  I was rewarded.

For around $10.50, the lunch menu offers a Bento box as well as a combination sushi lunch which I opted for.  Miso Soup, and my choice of two maki (Hamachi Nega Maki, Spicy Tuna Roll), brought out well crafted fare that was light, fresh, and satisfying.  A steaming cup of green tea reinvigorated me almost enough to step back out into a day of rain.

It's nothing fancy during the daytime but their offering is satisfying and I've no doubt I'll return.  Takara Sushi?  Nice to finally see you.
author: Tracey A.

description:
I've only been here once during lunch and they were closing in an hour. Two of my friends and I ordered from the lunch menu and the price is decent for a Japanese restaurant but I have to say that the portions are a bit on the smaller side. I got a bento box with 2 items; salmon shioyaki and tempura. It was good but nothing spectacular. My tempura came with a small slice of eggplant, small slice of zucchini, a piece of broccoli, a slice of sweet potato (I think), and one tempura shrimp including a small salad, rice, and miso soup. 

However, one of my friends ordered their tempura udon and that looked so good! I was immediately regretful of my decision and wished I had ordered that! She said it was very delicious and would recommend so my guess is that you would probably get more of a bang for your buck ordering the udon. 

The waiter was very kind and helpful though! I think I would try this place again for the udon but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Christina C.

description: This is the best sushi in the Castro, no question.  Ken has been my server for the last 3 years and he always makes sure I leave happy.  Plus, he remembers my name every time I come in.  But enough about Ken, you probably want to know if the sushi is good.  When I arrived, I asked if they had any seasonal fish and he pulled out a whole Black Sea Bream that had arrived that morning and chopped up some nigiri for me that was incredible!!!!  Service is amazing, fish is freshest in the Castro, and I always leave with a smile on my face.  Pricing is very reasonable and they have lunch specials too that are very well priced.  You will not be disappointed!
author: Will H.

description:
This place serves quality sushi. The nigiri is fantastic. Specifically the salmon is excellent. I couldn't be more pleased. The only issues I will mention is that the goyza wasn't as fantastic as I hoped. Also the service was subpar, my meal was brought out 15 minutes before my guests.

I would suggest going between 430 and 6 PM on Sunday through Thursdays because you can get their discounted manual where all the nigiri he is 2.50 a piece and appetizers are significantly discounted. You'll end up spending about half that you would otherwise.

I'll definitely be returning but I will only be ordering Sushi and miso soup.
author: Zoe Z.

description: We had some excellent sushi here tonight.  They carry gluten free soy sauce and are very good at letting you know what you are safe eating here.  We had the x-roll, summer roll, rainbow roll and the special roll of the night.  My wife enjoyed the hamachi kama and my daughter loved her udon noodles.
author: Zen D.

description: This place is phenomenal. Great, quick and friendly service! Came in for lunch, tried to rainbow roll and the "the bomb" roll. Both were delicious! Ended with the mochi sampler. Would recommend 10/10!!
author: Taylor J.

description: We have been ordering here every week for the last 3 years. Tonight was the last time. We never write yelp reviews but we are making an exception for this one. The last 3 orders we made were absolutely not fresh. Sashimi, rolls, tuna tartar...everything had a sour or bitter taste. And when we called to let them know they did not care, did not want to recognize the issue and asked us to contact Eat24! Because this is the 3rd time in 3 weeks, it looks like this has become a recurring problem with this restaurant. We will be ordering from a different place moving forward.
author: Johanna A.

description: Another restaurant with a vermin infestation. I wish people in San Francisco would stop going to places that have infestations because there's no incentive for them to clean up. Why risk getting sick?
author: Emma M.

description: Don't come here with kids. I've been here a handful of times with one kid, two kids, polite quiet kids, normal fidgety kids. Every single time the staff has been exceptionally rude- weird comments directed at the kids or parents. It's very disheartening and I wouldn't usually let service get in the way of the food quality. The food itself is slightly above average but not really worth the hollow atmosphere
author: Rachel M.

description:
TLDR - Quality sushi/sashimi in the Castro. Small, cozy spot for dining in, but they also have delivery/take-out.

My friend and I called and ordered take-out from Takara. Our order was ready really quickly (but it was also just sashimi so it was pretty simple/easy). The restaurant looked small and intimate when we went to pick up our order. It wasn't too busy for lunch on a weekday, but I can imagine potentially a wait for dinner or on weekends.

We ordered the CHEF'S CHOICE ($40), which consisted of 18 pieces of assorted sashimi, or 3 pieces of 6 different sashimi. I'm honestly not great at identifying sashimi, so I'm not sure what everything was. There was the usual salmon, hamachi and two kinds of tuna, and then two white cuts of sashimi. My favorite was one of the white ones, which was incredibly buttery and creamy in texture. The salmon was very good as well.

There's also other items you can order here: nigiri, rolls, teriyaki and other meat/fish entrees, udon, and hot/cold appetizers. Prices are pretty typical for sushi/Japanese and the sashimi is good quality. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for sushi in the Castro area!
author: Jessie L.

description:
Came here around closing and it was still buzzing with people! Located off Castro this sushi place is my favorite in the Bay Area, it was my 5th time going here!

When I went here last I sat at the window seat which has a great view of the road and one of the two TVs in the restaurant, and they where playing the Clippers game at the time.

I ordered Sake, Volcano Roll and Yummy role. I strongly recommend to get the yummy and volcano rolls if you like crunchy flakes.

Service was quick and efficient, very friendly and brought out the food pretty quickly. I would strongly recommend this place if you want to try a very good sushi place that has high quality sushi at a good price!
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Takara is normally excellent, and recently (8mos approx.) the take out service has been excellent as well.
We order once or twice a week. One of our favorite dishes is the beef sukyiaki. They haven't had any beef for the last three weeks. WTF??? We'll order when the beef returns.
author: Carl B.

description: Decent food but we went in Saturday with six people and the service wasn't great at all.   Waited nearly forty minutes for our minimal sushi order while the rest of our table and most of the rest of the restaurant was served.   They need to work on their speed.   On the plus side, food was tasty when it finally arrived.
author: Christopher L.

description: Very disappointed, placed an order on eat24 for pickup. When I got to the restaurant they told me that the item I ordered was actually $6 more than what it said online. Sorry but when you plan on paying one thing and get blindsided by another price I was caught off guard.  So instead of them honoring their online prices they just decided to let me leave upset.  It doesn't make any sense.  If I were to have ordered delivery would they have told the driver the same thing?  Terrible customer service. Waste of time. Lost a recurring customer. :(
author: Kay B.

description: Went here to try their Volcano Roll.It was delicious and my wallet didn't suffer! Definitely going to go back to try other items from their menu.
author: Anna Y.

description:
I love sushi, and it's hard to screw it up for me.
1) the fish was DRY.  Just low quality.
2) location of the restaurant is in a good spot.  Castro is fun to walk around.
3) waiter was pretty rude and kept correcting the way I spoke which became annoying after the 4th or 5th time.  
4)  I've had pretty good sushi in the city at the same price range, so this will not be a place I would return.
author: Robert W.

description:
This place sucks the device sucks there really rude 
And the waitress is horrible I dirty my napkin and she their to throw it away and replace I'm give
Min normally that would now good thing but she is removing my Edamami befor I even finished dame near took out mouth to Theiw the plate not feeling this place at ALL BOOOOOOOOOOOO IS ALL I GOT TO SAY ON SNOTHER NOTE food was good but service was horrible will never come agin ciao
author: Kassandra P.

description: Takara Sushi is solid, fresh, and soooo good every time! Great service and quality sushi. All of their rolls are amazing and the presentation is great. Their dragon roll is my favorite. Also a delicious sake and happy hour selection. Good vibes at Takara!
author: Ryan M.

description: Don't be fooled by any review you read anywhere.... very disappointing restaurant bad service, average food, below average staff....exactly 1 hour and 10 mins till we got our food and the restaurant was half full....avoid it of you can
author: Azwar A.

description: Delicious, local sushi bar with fabulous selection of fresh fish and exotic creations. I loved Bruce's choice, a yummy  concoction of spicy tuna, garlic chips, asparagus served hot! Loved their generous selection of sake options. It has a lovely bar area with super friendly and gregarious sushi chefs who will provide great recommendations! They had a delicious and popular selection of menu specials, including exotically named 'heads will roll'! I'd recommend checking this yummy, quaint sushi joint conveniently located in the heart of the Castro!
author: William H.

description:
Decent sushi but not the best or worst, not authentic Japanese place, a little bit sloppy, our sushi rolls were falling apart once picking them up, we sat at the sushi bar and saw the sushi being made, one gross thing we found in our sushi is a piece of hair...gross :$
Keep that wallet and go somewhere else
author: Arcadian B.

description: Food was ok. Especially for how long I waited for it to be prepared and it wasn't even that busy. Wish they had a slightly bigger menu to look at as far as their sushi rolls.
author: Matthew J.

description: Meh it's A-okay. The service is excellent but I like V16 in the Mission better for more variety and taste. This is an okay option for Japanese food in the Castro though. Not too many menu options but the basics are offered. Would be better if they offered more kinds of donburi and noodles. Place is a little dark and small too. Take this review with a grain of salt because I've been to Japan many times so my standard for Japanese food is high.
author: Myles L.

description: Food is always a hit here.  If you love sashimi, try the Chef's Choice which includes 18 pieces of super fresh, delicately sliced sashimi.  The tempura is also well prepared - very crispy, not overly battered or oily.  Try the A5 Wagyu Beef Nigiri for a special treat.  Service is attentive and friendly.  Very nice selection of Sake.  Plenty of TVs playing the game.  Truly a gem in the Castro neighborhood.
author: Roger E.

description: Every dish we picked was delicious. I dunno if we were just lucky or what but man. From the salad to the mains. The staff was really sensitive to us too and was really sincere too. The place is cozy, and they were playing the warriors game on tv lol serving was pretty small for the price, but the overall taste made up for it.
author: Kit A.

description: Reviewing takeout order: Finally tried a new local take out place b/c the ones that do takeout or delivery near Noe Valley have been disappointing and underwhelming at best. I was really happy that the fish tasted very fresh and there were a lot of options. I will definitely order pick up from here again. A couple of cons though--the edamame wasn't good (at least for takeout), it was dry, shriveled, and saltless; the wasabi didn't have any heat; and finally, the spicy scallop roll had very little scallop in it (more cucumber than anything). Cons aside, this will be my new go-to for in-home sushi b/c the quality of the fish is better than others nearby and I would anticipate that the edamame is better if you are eating it live in the restaurant.
author: R S.

description:
sushi is hard to find on a sunday during lunchtime.  i had just finished a 1 hour and 45 min yoga class, so i definitely was hungry.  this place was around the corner from yoga tree, so i came and got a chirashi lunch special, which came w/ miso soup and salad.  you know this restaurant does not cater to an asian crowd if they give you a spoon w/ your miso soup.

the chirashi was fine, but it was a bit skimpy.  i think the rice could have used more seasoning/vinegar as well.  i was hungry, so i ate the whole thing anyway.
author: Helen T.

description: One of my favorite spots when I'm in the Castro area. The restaurant is small and can be a bit crowded but the staff is always very nice and attentive. Have always tried different items from the menu when I'm there and it is a great experience every time. Highly recommend that you stop by.
author: Cris H.

description: Nice and cozy place for some yummy sushi! Service is nice. Food is yummy. Cleanliness. And just a nice environment to hang it with friends and chat. Will definitely come around again for date nights with my hubby and friends!
author: Mei O.

description:
The Best Sushi in the Castro and def one of the best sushi restaurants in Sf.
You have to try the fire balls as an app & Spunk roll is my fav.
I Love this place!!
author: arzo n.

description:
Hmm... I have no idea why this place is rated with 4-star. After a delivery eating experience I would say 2-star is maximum.

So, I ordered delivery through doordash and the expected delivery time was 7:57pm. At 7:12pm restaurant confirmed the order and begun to prepare the food, and the food wasn't be able to pick up until 8:16pm and finally got our food at 8:24pm. Almost an 30-min delay. Okay let me assume it is not the restaurant's problem but rather the delivery service itself; but the food was mediocre.

Tonkatsu: C.
Okay, probably delivery of fried food was not a smart idea (foiled paper was used and a hole was cut at the lid preventing damping fried food with moisture), but it couldn't have been that bad? Very hard to chew. Moreover, some cheese was added in the middle of each piece of tonkatsu, the combination was super weird and it did not taste good at all.

Eggplant: B-.
It was some small pieces of eggplant topped with shrimp and scallop. Not sure the appropriate temperature but both the eggplant and seafood was cold. The eggplant barely had taste in it.

Spicy Tuna Roll: B.
Decent, spicy tuna was with okay freshness.

X-Roll: B-.
It's some salmon+tuna-topped roll with mayo. Fish freshness was average. The mayo did not do the job to enhance or add an interesting taste to the roll.

Hamachi Sushi: B+.
The hamachi was considered fresh. But the sushi as a whole was not impressive. Cold rice.

Salmon Sushi: B-.
The salmon was not fresh at all. Don't have much to say about it.

Portion of each dish was small. Yet it turned out to be ~$49+tax total. A very unsatisfying meal. Won't go back again, not delivery nor dine-in.
author: Simon C.

description: The food is very good here! The sushi is fresh and the service is friendly and attentive. The beef teriyaki is super yummy, the sauce is so good and the beef has great flavor. Overall this is a great restaurant!
author: Natalye P.

description:
I've been here a few times and I never leave disappointed. My favorite rolls are the crazy roll and the red dragon roll. Their fish is always fresh (wel all of the fish I've had was). The miso is also pretty darn good. Service is always great, as well. 

The only thing on my wish list would be some sort of waiting area... I understand space is limited, but standing in the same area people are eating and vice versa is uncomfortable. 

Overall, I would recommend this to my friends and family, and I'll be back!
author: Sarah P.

description: Ordered the Volcano Roll and the Salmon Lover Roll . Did not disappoint . Definitely would recommend this place . The service and ambiance was remarkable and I found it pretty cool how they served edamame as a little appetizer for free . Total was about $30 including tip . Overall great experience
author: Sky C.

description:
Even though I had a passing curiosity about its previous identity as an intimate Asian fusion restaurant, I never made it here when Sumi ran this spot. It looked attractive, but I heard mixed notices about the food. When she retired six years ago, it completely fell off my radar, and when it changed names, it might as well have entered the witness protection program. Then one night, I was at Curry Boyz right across the street and glanced over. Suddenly it looked inviting to me. It only took ten years. Par for the course for me. Anyway, Jamie W. and I finally made it here after checking out the new rainbow crosswalks at 18th and Castro.

They just opened for the evening, so they were just setting up for dinner. Naming the place Takara didn't help me remember me since it's a pretty common Japanese name. There's even a restaurant in J-Town with the same name. It's kinda like naming a place Sam's. Anyhow, it's mainly sushi though they have standard Japanese fare if you prefer something that's been near a stove. Our meal began with a $5.95 plate of Gyoza which were pretty well grilled and provided a satisfying start (photo: http://bit.ly/1xyaZmn). We segued into a $4.95 plate of Grilled Eggplant slices sprinkled with chopped scallions and accompanied by a ponzu dipping sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1tL62XB).

Good, not mushy though a tad lukewarm. The sight of Ankimo on a menu always makes me excited like a little girl wearing her first training bra. So for $8.50, a plateful was in order, and it was just as fresh a piece of monkfish liver as I could hope for, nicely sliced and also accompanied by ponzu sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1IjkSpm). That was gone so quickly I'm surprised Jamie still has fingers. Then our main sushi order arrived on one plate. To accommodate Jamie's taste, we had the $5.95 King California Roll which contains real versus imitation crab, a worthwhile dollar surcharge for the real thing (photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGk7N).

Nothing really to say about the roll except that it was put together as expected and tasted fine for a California roll, I suppose. I ordered the $12.95 X-Roll, an elaborate creation with yellowtail, avocado, tuna and salmon, drizzled with an aioli-like spicy sauce and topped with tobiko (photo: http://bit.ly/1s0bMM3). It was a bit like a rainbow roll with mayo. Not a bad thing if you ask me. The last was the $14 O-Toro Nigiri, fatty tuna wrapped around rice with tiny shrimp in another sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1xzGqfP). That was quite good but I was finding it hard to justify the price in my head, just my belly. They do sushi well here, and it's well worth a try if you're in the mood.

FOOD - 4 stars...sushi well executed...and they have ankimo...score!
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tiny spot crowds easily so come earlier to avoid claustrophobia
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive enough but a bit aloof
TOTAL - 4 stars...probably your best sushi option in the Castro
author: Ed U.

description:
This is a great local sushi spot in the Castro.  Really good, fresh rolls here!  

The ambience is pretty no-frills in the way a lower price-range sushi spot often is, but you can't really go wrong with anything food-wise.  Most noteworthy was the Fire Ball, which is basically pieces of spicy tuna roll rolled into a ball, deep fried and covered with spicy mayo and other delicious sauces.  Prices are very reasonable as well.  Recommend it if you're in the area and craving sushi!
author: Christine G.

description: Sushi had good flavor. Would recommend the tsunami, dragon, rainbow, and volcano rolls! They were all excellent. Sauces have plenty of flavor and sushi came out pretty quick even though it was pretty busy.
author: Kiva C.

description: Sleazy owner. Do not buy Groupon for this restaurant! Owner makes excuses so you pay full price. Awful food!
author: L B.

description:
This place isn't bad...but I probably wouldn't return. The prices are reasonable...and rightly so as the sushi tastes like anything I could pick up at a local market.

The problems with Takara is the way it's so painfully...ordinary. There's literally nothing about it that makes you want to go running back after you're done. Same typical dishes on the menu, same boring taste of every other California roll you've had dozens of times before...basically uninspiring. 

If you're looking for affordable sushi that you also won't remember soon after... this is the place for you!
author: Destini M.

description:
After looking for a good sushi restaurant and trying a bunch of places, we finally found Takara!
The food is amazingly good, the dine-in experience is pretty nice (nice venue, friendly staff, right off Castro, nice-looking crowd), and for takeout they were among the fastest to prepare our food that I've ever seen.
Definitely recommended, our new favorite.
author: Daniele M.

description:
Came here on a wet Sunday afternoon to an empty restaurant. Ordered beer and hot sake with 5 food items. Waited 45 minutes and only got 3, waited another 20 minutes and the rest of the food wasn't ready. Literally paid $75 to get a little buzz on while waiting for food that never came. 

I'm still hungry while writing this review at another restaurant...
author: Dan L.

description: Ordered delivery from this place and I was not completely blown away, but hey it's better than McDonald's lol. I ordered the hamachi nigiri, the tuna tar tar, and 2 different rolls. The best item I ordered was the hamachi nigiri because it was relatively fresh. The rolls were very basic, but I felt like it was my fault because I couldn't really see pictures of the rolls online. The tuna tar tar was good but it could have been better if it was spicy. Overall, I may want to come back for a dine-in experience to see if this place will increase my expectations.
author: Ricardo R.

description: I don't eat fish so I may not be the best person to review a sushi place- but the veggie fish options were super good (got the avocado maki and sweet potato tempura roll). The fish dishes looked amazing and seemed super inventive. They were also huge! I will definitely come back.
author: Karen D.

description:
I took the nigiri sampler. The fish was quite tasteless. The rice was OK. The wasabi was on the side, not between the fish and the rice. Definitely not worth the price.

I tried a piece of squash tempura from one of my friends and it was good.
author: Luca W.

description:
OHHHH YES. This place definitely deserves five stars. 

food - DELICIOUS
service - fast
ambiance - chill

I'd definitely recommend the Fire Cracker and Pink Dragon sushi rolls. :P SCRUMPTULICIOUS!
author: Zen T.

description: Writing a review for the service or lack thereof I received just now. Hours state that they are open for lunch until 230. I arrived at 220. I get that it's late. But without even asking me if I wanted to order food to go, the  woman at the counter simply said "We are closed."  When I responded, that the hours are until 230. She just repeated herself again with "We are closed."  Disappointing.  And quite unwelcoming.
author: Heather R.

description:
They have Asahi Black!!!!!!

regardless of the quality of the food, the fact that they have asahi black warrants 4 stars

the food was not back either, but i've had better japanese elsewhere
author: Long C.

description: I really like takara. It may not be the best sushi out there but it's close by and dependable. Good when you don't want to cook dinner and are just trying to pick up a few rolls.
author: Anna S.

description:
This is how I FELT after ordering delivery from here the first two times:

This is our go-to spot for sushi delivery.

I invite the Dragon Roll over at least weekly, no eggplant.

I ask for less rice, they hook it up. I ask for it to be packaged separately (not with my husband's sushi), and they hook it up. As a veggie, that's important to me.

They're always on time, even early. This matters when you're so hungry you're tempted to run outside and wait on the curb for your delivery.

This is how I FEEL after ordering lag-*** sushi from here the last two times:

Still on time, but seriously inedible. Did a sushiboss get fired, leave, or go on vacation???

Seems like it. 

My dragon roll moved in with NoFlavah. Yuck. Fuchi.

The veggie gyoza were pretty good, but had little tiny pools of oil all over them, so ugh, gotta drop these guys to 2 stars. That's me being generous, remember that.

Una estrella. Una nada mas.

My search for tasty sushi delivery continues.

Help me. Help me please.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Love the food here. So fresh and great service!  Always come back when I'm in the city.
author: Deborah B.

description:
Our fave sushi place in the Castro!  The sushi here is good.  The sashimi is fresh and delicious; the ocean trout is the best!  The agedashi tofu and udon are okay, nothing to write home about so I would skip that.  

If you can make it here for happy hour - Sunday through Thursday from 4:30 to 6:00 pm - you can get hand rolls for $2.80!  Get the unagi and avocado hand roll...soooo good!  And lots of other regular menu (both food and drink) items are featured in happy hour.  Super great deal!!
author: Jaching H.

description:
Goodness... This place is SO super yummy. 
I would recommend going during happy hour, there are TONS of options on there and they are all super yummy with large portions.

The thing that sucks about living in seattle is there are little to no competitive happy hours, here in San Fran however... WOW! such good price for a lot of food that was all quite tasty. 

Disclaimer: my wife and I kinda like "americanized" saucy-ish sushi, and this definitely tickled our fancys... 

TL;DR yum. cheap. lots.
author: Ross B.

description: Fresh fish, friendly service (although sometimes a little slow) and a great happy hour menu makes this my go to neighborhood sushi spot. Much better than the places on Castro street IMO.
author: P P.

description: It's always nice feeling to walk into a restaurant knowing the employees care for customers. The food and service is consistently great. I highly recommend for sushi lovers.
author: Kitty N.

description:
SF roll, chicken skins & oyster shooter...

2nd visit on our sushi hopping. Better than the 1st. The SF ROLL was fantastic, the chicken skins reminded me of pork rinds or cracklin, but the condiment with it was superb, something wasabi something...

And, the oyster shooter was wonderful (if you like oysters & raw egg).

Weds evening @ 8pm we got right in & service was so nice & prompt. 

Bathrooms were clean too.

*draught note: they provide water w/o request & keep refilling even after you say no more.

Since service is so prompt, the wait won't be long do give it a try.
author: Stacie R.

description:
Food (4/5): I shared the snow roll and the chef's sashimi with a friend. Snow roll has tempura shrimp and unagi inside, and crab, tobiko, and unagi sauce on the outside. Great combination of textures and flavors! The roll was pretty big, too.

 The chef's sashimi came with 3 slices each of 6 types of fish (tuna, salmon, scallop, walu, squid (?), and hamachi). Tasted pretty fresh, but the slices were really small.

Our other friend got the tempura udon, which came with a sizable portion of shrimp and veggie tempura. His food looked really good - I wished I ordered that! 

Service (5/5): Free edamame! Portions are really tiny though and no refills. We called in fifteen minutes before arriving and they were nice enough to hold a table for us. Servers were attentive and took care of us!

Value (4/5): Udon at ~$11 is prob the most value on the menu, but rolls ($6-14) aren't bad either. The chef's sashimi was $35 for 18 smallish pieces, which is okay too.
author: Abby S.

description: Takara is very solid and I've had good experiences both dining in and ordering from here.  The sushi is pretty good by Mission/Castro area standards, and they run a tight shop in terms of service.  The Volcano roll is a feast for the senses, a must-try if you're dining in.  The Spicy Geisha and Dinosaur roles are also quite good.
author: Saminda W.

description:
A flag went up when I walked up to the counter to pick up my to-go order and the fish case looked like a total mess.  The chirashi I ordered looked equally disastrous. The fish was not cut uniformly and some were hacked up.  Presentation is integral to sushi, even with to-go orders.  I have gotten chirashi to go from at least a dozen places. This one looked like someone took random end pieces, folded them up and crammed them into a box.   

Perhaps it was a good thing that the portion was cheap (price certainly was not) because the quality was low. There were two generous pieces of foul tasting fake crab. 

Not going back for more.
author: Hadas R.

description: Takara Sushi definitely has some delicious sushi. But the prices don't really align with the portions and the plates aren't overly aesthetically pleasing. The Veggie Dragon roll I had was great, but I'm not sure if I would want to pay $10.95 for it again.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Takara has friendly and attentive staff in a comfortable and cool looking restaurant.  The inside has two levels - the floor has tables by the front windows and the raised level up the steps opens up to a larger dining area.  I ordered the spicy tuna roll, red dragon roll, and miso soup.  The rolls were just okay.  The tuna didn't have much flavor.  The rice was cooked well however.  The price point for the sushi was pretty average for San Francisco standards.  I would give Takara another shot and try something different next time.
author: Josh S.

description: Great neighborhood sushi spot that never disappoints. Their specials are always on point and we love all their rolls. The fish tastes fresh and everything is prepared to perfection. Service is great we always ask what they like on the menu and they bring us the most incredible dishes! Hiramasa on Salt Block is a show stopper!
author: Victoria T.

description:
Pretty pricey but delicious. I love that they have good vegetarian sushi options. It was very creative in flavor. Highly recommend it. 

1. Veggie Dragon Roll (My favorite)
2. Veggie Gyoza
3. Veggie Joseph Mango Soy (Very creative and unique. It has Asparagus and mango)

Con:
1. They don't update their website or yelp when they are closed due to some holidays. So please call them to make sure they are open.
author: Hiral P.

description:
First off, the quality of the fish is excellent. Each time I think I've found my new favorite fish or roll I'll return and the chef manages to eclipse the previous experience.

Secondly, and no less important -- especially after my last sushi experience at a different restaurant -- the service here is simply incredible. It is beyond attentive. They engage: they ask questions and genuinely want to know what you like and will ask follow-ups after you've had a chance to try a special or one of their recommendations. You will NOT be left wondering where your server is (or where your food is) ever!  In fact, we had 3 different servers stopping by to bring food, clear dishes, take orders, answer questions, offer suggestions, etc. I cannot say enough good things about this place. I have found my new sushi home in San Francisco
author: BG M.

description: Terrible service!!!!!  How many times do I have to ask for a glass of water?  And a refill, oh my lord!!!!  Mediocre sushi.  Not bad, but certainly not great.   Overpriced foods.  Portions are acceptable.  Beware.  If you ask for water more than once,  stupid waiter will roll his eyes.  The entire staff doesnt know the meaning of a smile.  The table is dirty and has a sticky residue.  Wipe itttttt!!!
author: Jack T.

description: So delicious! Love the spicy salmon temaki and roll! Their happy hour specials are great (4:30-6pm I believe)!
author: Phoebe M.

description:
It's a very good sushi restaurant. 
One day I decided to change my rainbow roll (yes, I just love the rainbow roll) for a Salmon Tasting that was listed on the specials. Now I can't help it but order it every time! 5 different salmons, all so different from one another and at the same time all so rich.

I would also recommend the Shrimp Tempura. Sushi is not consistent, it relays on the sushi-man of the day, I wasn't disappointed, but I know there are better days than others...

The ambiance is nice, and the staff really friendly.
author: Maggie J.

description:
Good Sushi.
Takara special ( $26) was excellent.
Chicken udon ( $ 10.95) ) was good and filling.
Salmon rolls were fresh and tasty.
Overall good food.
author: Dani O.

description:
I'm very particular about my sushi, and when I'm in San Francisco my go-to place is Kiji on Guerrero Street. However, this time I decided to make a reservation at Takara in the Castro neighborhood. I had heard great things about it, and while I am always skeptical about restaurants in the Castro I threw caution to the wind. Well the wind blew it back in my face.

I decided to go all vegetarian, and luckily Takara has a very nice selection of vegetarian options. The Cucumber Sonomono was the first disappointment. The vinegar tasted as if it has been diluted with water, most of the cucumbers had not even been dipped in the vinegar let alone soaked in it. I actually had to pour soy sauce over it, to be able to eat it. The vegetable gyoza was the next item up, and they were perfectly prepared, golden and crisp on one side and the vegetables inside bursting with flavor. For my rolls I ordered the oshinko maki, and the vegetable dragon roll.

The oshinko was crisp and perfectly pickled, unfortunately the nori that it was wrapped in was stale and tough. The dragon roll was probably the highlight of the night. Well prepared, the nori was fresh, and the avocado and eggplant prepared with perfection.

Now comes the worst experience in my restaurant life. The wait staff appeared to be on speed. I have never in my life felt so rush at a restaurant. No sooner did I place the last piece of food in my mouth, they were there snatching away the empty plate. I was in and out of the restaurant in 30 minutes. I left stressed and completely unnerved by the overly hyper staff.

It was the first and last time at Takara Sushi. Take a lesson from your four-legged world traveler. Don't go here. There are so many better places in the city to get really fine sushi and to do so in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. Keep walking my friends, keep walking.

With love from my dog bowl to yours...happy eating.

shatasdogbowl
author: DJ S.

description:
I walked in promptly for my 7:30 reservation and as I entered my glasses steamed over. The place was totally packed on a Thursday night. Tons of people were waiting and I'm glad we had the reservation. Seems my 5 year old was the only kid in this place at the time. I thought that was a bit surprising and I'm glad we had the front window seat. This helped my daughter out with a boring adult dinner situation as she could partake in some people watching.

I did notice that sitting next to the door kind of sucked. Way to much traffic and people crowding in to get a seat.I like that the place ifs seating for 35. It's large enough to keep a steady flow, but small enough to feel very personal.

All of the sushi tasted super fresh. We had the sashimi combo and a ton of rolls.
The spicy tuna roll was perfect. I thought the ankimo was not as good as some places but it was better than most.
author: Ben M.

description: I live in the neighborhood and the rolls here are great and fresh for what you can get in the heart of the Castro. I'd come more often but the service is subpar at best. None of the staff there are professionals and the only thing they're focused on is bringing food from the sushi bar or kitchen to the table and that about sums it up. Zero service level. I remind myself though that I shouldn't have high expectations for a local spot. I wish I could call this a neighborhood gem - they are close on the food but the service needs to improve greatly.
author: ellelle l.

description: Consistently delicious, I always go down here with my boyfriend, and easily one of the best joints that you can find in the Castro. Great service, great food.
author: Teresa I.

description:
Almost a year ago, I came to Takara sushi with my boyfriend for dinner.

My first impression about Takara was that the restaurant was very clean and sushi bar like. We were seated immediately next to the window.

Being that it was so long ago, the names of the sushi rolls escape me however I do remember that we were offered edamame and that the portion of the rolls were very small. Taste of the rolls weren't worth remembering either.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I'm sitting here waiting for delivery. It's been 74 minutes so far. Eat24 hasn't responded, and I'm not sure if they will, but I figure I'll kill 10 minutes writing this thing.

This is our first time ordering delivery. We've been to the restaurant twice. It's pretty good if you go to the restaurant. Not fantastic, but pretty good. Better than Osaka, which is my other favorite for the Castro. 

So I didn't check the reviews before I ordered, which I'm beginning to think was unwise. Because they're pretty consistently awful. I don't know what the issue is, I've used Eat24 a few times and it can be sometimes late but not terribly so and I don't think it's ever been like this, so it's definitely the restaurant. 

(later) 
I'm not sure when it will get here, but it's been 90 minutes. I called the restaurant, and confirmed that the food had been made and the driver had already left so I'm not going to cancel. The restaurant manager says when they're busy it takes longer but Eat24 doesn't reflect that, or they can't communicate that it takes longer. But I would definitely never order delivery here, especially through Eat24. I don't think they're really set up for it, even though it's technically on the list. Stick to walk-in.
author: Amy T.

description: I'm updating my previous review.  We've come here multiple times and the sushi creations never cease to amaze us. Every one I've ever brought here has been impressed with the sushi and other non-sushi items. I'm uploading a photo of the "taco" appetizer which is made with fried seaweed as the "shell" and filled with crabmeat and other veggie trimmings.
author: ALISON Y.

description:
Small restaurant two blocks off the Castro, this is a nice little place to get some good Japanese food. I'm not a sushi fan, so I won't comment on the sushi quality. But, the chicken Katsu was good, as was the way the tempura was prepared (not too much batter). Cal rolls had a good amount of crab meat and less of the rice (nice). Although, the teriyaki beef was a bit on the chewy side.
Service was great, and the dining space was clean and inviting.
author: Greg S.

description: I had a great experience! I had X-roll and california King sushi. They prepared my food very fast. And the food was very delicious and fresh!
author: Mahssa G.

description:
I've ordered delivery from this restaurant at least 20 times in the past year or so.  Up until the most recent order, I would have given this restaurant 5 stars.  The food is very good.  The guy who delivered it was always prompt, polite, and prepared.  

My last time ordering from here was, unfortunately, the last time.  I placed an order with Eat24 (as I always do), and at the end delivery was estimated at 50-70 minutes.  After 80 minutes without any delivery, I contacted Eat24 and they let me know my food had left the restaurant 20 minutes prior, and it was on its way.  Another 20 minutes passed, so i contacted Eat24 again and they told me the same thing. 

I live less than a 5-minute drive from the restaurant, so this was unusual.  Whenever I order, I post my phone number twice to make sure it's on the receipt, but I never got a call.  

Finally, after waiting 2 hours, a new delivery guy showed up.  He looked very...  Dazed and confused, to put it in a non-incriminating tone.  I asked what took so long.  "Well, um...  I, yeah, um...  The people before weren't happy with their order, so I had to get a new one."  I shrugged it off and waited for my receipt to sign.  "I...  um...  I don't have a pen."  Before I could offer to go get one myself, he left with my unsigned receipt.  Did he forge it?  Wrap it around white sage for a cleansing ritual?  That unfortunately was left a mystery.

The food was completely cold when I opened it, and my agedashi tofu was missing its sauce.  I decided to call the restaurant to let them know I had an issue with the delivery. The woman I spoke with cut me off mid-sentence, "So we are very busy tonight.  That's why it took so long.  Ok?  Thank you."  

Not that I'm anyone special, but since I'd become a regular of this restaurant, and always tipped 20% (although in SF maybe that's a pittance), I was expecting the courtesy of a phone call that my order would be late, a delivery person who was lucid, or at the very least an apology from Miss Busy.  

So I won't be patronizing Takara anymore.  Maybe it's better when you dine at the restaurant, but I suppose they've gotten too big to care about the little people who order their delivery.  At least it's an opportunity to find other great Japanese food in the city.
author: Navi Y.

description:
The Verdict:
Good Miso soup and Decent Rolls, however you're coming here for the ambiance, food is overpriced for what it was. 
=============================================
Dropped in on a Wendesday 6:20pm I was craving sushi and this place was nearby Bi-Rite Creamery. 
The waitstaff is fairly attentive and I was welcomed in almost immediately.

Its not a large place, seats ~30 persons, once we were seated we were told to move since they wanted to reserve that one area for a large party at 7:30. I thought that was a bit odd, but reaffirmed that we would be finished before then. 

Onto the food: I had the dinosaur roll and my girlfriend had the vegetable tempura. I felt the price's were a bit steep and the portions to be underwhelming. I was planning to ask for a menu for another set of rolls, however the Dinosaur roll didn't increase my appetite. The fried crab was too dry and had very jerky-like texture to it. The vegetable tempura it what it is -- not sure how they can just charge $10+ for it but that isn't the point.

I do want to mention they have some really fresh ginger -- it was very potent and STRONK!

My experience:
Service : 3.5 / 5
It was meh, I think they had a new guy whom was pretty forgetful. Also being told to move shows that is some internal miscommunication occurring.
Food : 2.5 / 5
It wasn't bad per say but $30 for two mediocre rolls and one was a simple vegetarian roll? I definitely didn't feel like I got much value. 
Atmosphere: 4.5 / 5
Clean, well kept with a modern feel. I actually really liked the decor and the music too, however they were playing from an iPod (nothing wrong with that!) but the genre of music was inconsistent.


I feel that I have to draw attention to something unusual.... I was really taken-aback by how nice their bathroom was -- mainly the cleanliness & the large fresh sunflowers felt like I was in a home than a restaurant.
author: Sargon J.

description: Not a place for vegetarian.  Over priced vegetarian selection. Order asparagus,  3 stripes for $6!. Salad just handful of mixed spring green with a few slides of cucumber for $7!. Sorry, will not be back.
author: Melvon M.

description: The food has been good so far but, small portions and over priced... The waitresses are ok but it's been over 20-30 minutes for our sushi rolls... They are overwhelmed.
author: William J.

description: Great food. Pretty good service given it was a Friday night. After things settled down, the waiters started coming over, frequently poured tea and followed up with additional request. Ordered agadashi tofu for appetizer. It could have used some seasoning but was hot and fresh out the kitchen. For thr main course, ordered kamikaze, Tokyo, and Volcano roll. All delicious. The sake yozushoju was sweet and tart. Went down really well with the food. Recommendation, make sure you make reservations. Every person that came in after us at 7 pm had one.
author: Hoosie U.

description:
i've eaten inside the restaurant and gotten delivery too. They are really attentive to the customer in the restaurant, i've always had excellent fast service, and they have always delivered fresh and hot food on time. 
I really like their volcano roll, the mango is a nice sweet touch and tempura crunchies are nice and hot while the roll is fresh, great contrast, plus its looks crazy. like a volcano....
and the pink dragon roll is really good, i've ordered it unbaked too
salmon nigiri has always been fresh
watch out for meter maids when you park tho...
author: Anais B.

description:
Delicious... this used to be my go to place for Sushi in Logan, but I since found I like Sushi Ya a bit better.

Good and friendly service, but there's room for improvement when they get busy and the food is amazing... I just wish it was 'all you can eat'.
author: Nick C.

description:
A bunch of friends and I decided to grab dinner here. I chose this place because I walked past it one day while I was looking for a cafe. It looked promising so I kept it bookmarked. 

I was not disappointed. The place itself is small in space, but still nice inside. Very traditional Japanese. The workers are friendly and are way too good at refilling our drinks.

I ordered an oyster shooter and the Pumpkin for myself. I was iffy about the Pumpkin because the dish only comes in two pieces....but after eating it,  was not disappointed. The pieces are large and are succulent fish wise. The fish if very fresh and tasty! I enjoyed every single bite. 

The oyster shooter was good too. I actually took this first. I wasn't really sure what to expect but it's basically a shot of sake, raw oyster, quail egg, and shallots. I've never had sake before but my friends scared me into thinking I'd definitely throw it up. On the contrary, it was quite tasty. I mean, shots aren't meant to be savored, but the aftertaste was actually good. 

My friends enjoyed the dishes they got too. One friend got the summer roll which seemed special because it's wrapped with soy instead of nori, but it wasn't that great to me.

By the end of our meal, we decided to order the mochi sampler. $8 for 3 mochis is expensive, but the quality of the ice cream mochi we got was really good. We chose to get green tea, red bean, and mango. They were nice enough to cut it into fours, assuming we were all sharing. Our of all the flavors, I liked mango the best...and I don't typically like mango. 

Overall, wonderful sushi joint. I'm pretty picky with sushi and I think I consider this my favorite thus far.
author: Sofia R.

description: Delivery was 30 minutes late. Tempura was cold and soggy. Ikura sushi was half the normal size.
author: Sue R.

description:
I find it generally very hard to find good sushi delivery as the restaurants that offer delivery often seem to have rubbery fish.  Live Sushi Bistro has been my go to place for years, but the last few times, the quality has definitely gone downhill. So I started looking around for another sushi delivery option.  Thanks to Yelp, I found Takara.  

First order was great!  There's an easy online ordering process, it said food would be delivered in 45-60 minutes and it came at 52 minutes, and the sushi was very good.  half expected my hotate salad to show up soggy, but the mixed greens were great, with cherry tomatoes, slices of scallop, and there was just the right amount of yuzu vinaigrette.  The sake and hamachi nigiri were generous in size and also very fresh, and the 49er roll was perfectly fine (although a little boring).  Plus delivery was free with $30+ orders.  

I'll definitely be ordering from Takara again!
author: Vivian W.

description:
Fabulous Food and Great Execution


Service is something I'm always amazed. There is a lack of professionalism and by experience it does upset me how been a regular customer  and requesting a fresh wasabi charge you $3 and other times not. 


It's not the $3, it's the sense of customer appreciations. Everytime we dine at Takara we spent over $100 between 2 people w/o drinks. 

I'd rather do take out, from now on.
author: Yeray L.

description:
Really good sushi, small place, really friendly staff and chef.
The rolls are amazing, especially the "yummy roll", a must have! 
They have a "special" board menu every day and they are happy to help you find a new fish to try.
author: Fabrice E.

description:
Walked in with the boyfriend on a random weekday for dinner. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Water glasses brought soon thereafter and orders taken quickly and efficiently. 

EATS
+Miso soup: Good, strong broth, not watered down; the right amount of seaweed, green onion, and tofu.
+Negi hamachi maki roll: Yellowtail with grreen onion. A small portion, but just how I like it.
+Unagi donburi: grilled freshwater eel over rice with unagi sauce. Tasty and filling: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/takara-sushi-san-francisco?select=IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg#IM15oB7zInJytQk2BfKRrg

All in all, a pleasant experience with good food and fair prices. Not bad for a sushi joint in the Castro.
author: Adena B.

description:
Came here to eat after bar hopping during happy hour on sunny Sunday Funday. For Americanized sushi, its decent. We ordered a bunch of rolls. They were ok. The volcano roll was a bit unusual though. It was a roll covered in deep fried panko; a bit different. 

I didn't have a chance to order the nigiri sushi so I cant attest to the freshness of their nigiri. I would've been a little more critical on that if I tried it since I am a traditionalist when it comes to eating sushi and sashimi. However, their rolls were pretty decent.
author: Kenson K.

description:
happy to have found another decent place for sushi. not cheap, but it's not going to break your bank either. conveniently located in the castro and close to a number of good bars. 

ankimo was so good! they also have raw shrimp here - i didn't try it but was told it's too chewy.
author: Thao T.

description:
I've been here twice with my two friends, who are frequenters of this restaurant, and I've only ever had stellar food and great service.

The salmon tartare is really nice and fresh. There are so many rolls to choose from (try X-Roll or Dragon). I love their Takara edamame as well as other sides like their poblano peppers and eggplant.

Everyone who works here is super nice, and I've never had a dish I didn't like!
author: Jess L.

description:
1 star, never going back. 

First, when we ordered 2 salmon tasting plates, the server said the sushi chef would cut to accommodate 5 people, they didn't. She offered to bring it back, but it was fine. Didn't realize this would be indicative of the entire meal.

For our main meal, a friend and I both ordered bento boxes with cooked food. These came out 40 minutes after we ordered, and everything was cold. Our friends ordered sushi, so I bet they just timed the food wrong and let it sit in the kitchen. 

When I let our server know the food was cold, she asked us if we wanted to reheat or remake the food. We said remake. When she came out with the food 10 minutes later, it was clear that the salmon teriyaki and saba shioyaki were reheated, and they didn't even touch to the cold tonkatsu. Why bother asking if you're not going to do what is requested? I was so mad I told my friend I wasn't going to eat the cold tonkatsu. The server overheard me saying this and asked if I wanted it reheated. Why didn't you just remake the entire thing the first time I sent it back? If i'm sending food back a second time, there's no way I'm going to eat it anymore. I told her no thanks because I was starving.

At that point, I guess she felt bad (or that her tip was in jeopardy) so the kitchen sent us two fresh tonkatsus "on the house". Too little too late - 1) why didn't you just do this the first time the food was sent back!?!? and 2) the only reason they gave it to us "on the house" (oh thank you for your generosity) was because the server felt bad the second time, not even the first time. Kudos for feeling bad, but seriously, I've never been to a restaurant who tried so little to make up for a bad experience.

The owners/chef/server/whoever clearly didn't care about doing it right the first time, so this place clearly seems to me not to care much about the customer. It doesn't cost much to remake two portions in the grand scheme of things - I was a server for a long time before and during college, and I would have never treated my guests like that. I'm not asking for much, but just to have things given as ordered. I just hate that I felt like a second chance wasn't enough, but that I had to give a third and a fourth. Lucky them my friend was still nice enough to tip 15%. I'm not stingy, but people don't typically tip under 15, and if they do, it's because something needs to be seriously reconsidered and made better, whether that's food, service quality or both.
author: Joanie W.

description: Deeply unsatisfying delivery food. Probably the worst Udon I've ever had. Flavorless broth, rubber seafood. The hamachi nigiri tasted not the freshest, the gyoza was a little burnt on the bottom. So the quality has gone down in my opinion and I will never eat here again.
author: Lisa B.

description:
So this place isn't the best sushi that I've ever had, but it is good.

I come here whenever I am around the Castro area and need my sushi fix.

Overall, items on the menu were pretty expensive. But from what I have had so far, the food was pretty good.

My favorite is the Chirashi bowl. For $19, I get soup, salad, and a generous portion of fish. They don't skimp here on the fish like other places I've ordered Chirashi from.

I would avoid getting the beef tataki. It came out after we had already finished our sushi. It was overcooked as well. Our leading theory was that it needed to be defrosted then quickly grilled before brought to our table. The sauce tasted great! But this still couldn't mask the quality of the beef.

Bonus points: they deliver. 

If you are looking for a good sushi fix on a decent budget, this may be a place to try out.
author: Eric C.

description:
Takara's focus seems to be on novelty rolls that are slathered in sauce, and considering the location it appears to have generated all the hyped interest for them.  The interior is clean, cohesive, and well kept.. and all the servers are very friendly.

However, my sashimi and nigiri selection were lacking.. the emphasis seemed to be on presentation over freshness.  It is definitely within the right price range for this location, but I would rather ditch the overwhelming 18th street for a taste of something tastier at Kama (on Church), or Ino (in Japantown).
author: Ty T.

description: I LOVE this place! Takara is one of my fav sushi place in town and always love their services. Fish is awesome and hv a good variety of different fresh fish. I love their Seared butter fish sushi and Ocean Trout sushi. Highly recommanded! Ask for their special
author: Katie M.

description: I had the X Roll, Red Dragon, and Pink Dragon. All were really good! I like lots of flavors in my sushi rolls and this totally hit the spot. Delivery was faster than expected, too. I would recommend for sure.
author: Rebeccah Y.

description: Pricey sushi for okay quality and beef teriyaki is dry and it taste like store bought sauce. The quality of the fish is similar to the groceries where they sell sashimi or even worse.  Nothing special about this place and I think the live sushi on Taraval is better quality than this place and it's cheaper there. I only go here when I'm around castro and I'm craving for Japanese food.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: Great sushi! Simple combinations that yielded excellent taste results. We weren't looking for anything extravagantly cooked or doused in sauce, and we were greatly satisfied with our experience here! The rainbow roll and volcano roll were definitely the standouts of the meal.
author: Mandy L.

description: Great neighborhood sushi spot! We go here all the time, always good service and always delicious!
author: Julie H.

description:
Fresh sushi, easy crowd.

We were a walk-in on a Tuesday evening, and it was pretty busy at 7:30 pm. Fortunately, we only waited 10 minutes to be seated.  Overall, the sushi was fresh and tasty:  

- Summer Roll: Fresh, and clean. The salmon is complimented well with the escolar for a nice tasty treat
- X-Roll: Very good, but the spicy sauce seemed a little but much.
- The Bomb: It had a lot going on, but it was fresh and well balanced.

Nice vibe, small tables.  It is busy, so definitely worth it to get reservations in advance.
author: Natalie G.

description: I ordered from Takara sushi thinking it was related to the Takara by Fillmore/japantown, can't be. First it took twice the time to get here than quoted (45 mins vs hour and a half) and I was only a few blocks away. The wasabi was fake. The teriyaki chicken was unlike any I've ordered from a Japanese restaurant, it was like "I got it at Ross". The chicken literally looked like large boogers. My best friend who always likes to mooch on my food did not even attempt to lol. The roll as if made by a robot, no flavor and low quality. And that bit of food for $39!! i was hoping to have leftovers but even the portions were small. I'm still hungry and feel disgusted from the quality of food. Couple that with the price and I feel robbed.
author: Belito L.

description:
You know there is something wrong with your dinner when you end up across the street and eat a second dinner. This place must be rating themselves or they wouldn't have fallen so flat. The sushi and sashimi was nothing to be amazed about. In fact, it was utterly disappointing. This place may try to look fancy but it is not up to par compared to other Japanese restaurants in the city. 

First, who sears O-toro especially when I ordered sashimi. If I wanted cooked fish I would order it. But I ordered sashimi and I expected a piece of raw fish but instead I end up with half cooked fish. Is there something wrong with it like maybe it was about to spoil thus you cooked it? After I ate my order of O-toro I began to wish I had not ordered it at all. It gave me a bad after taste and I felt it might have been spoiled because of the strong fishy smell, but not the good kind. Besides the O-toro I ordered Uni, which again is disappointing because the Uni looked pale yellow and is doused with soy sauce. I actually like my seafood nice and clean so the only garnish I really put on my raw seafood is a small dab of wasabi and that is IT. No soy sauce. So I was disappointed to see that the chef had put soy sauce over the uni. Another disappointment was that instead of one or two large pieces of uni placed over rice, I had small little bits almost what I consider the leftovers scraped off the bottom of the container stuffed on top of rice with some type of edible paper wrapped around it. It was utterly sad and I cannot start to describe the despair I felt when I saw it. But down the hatch it went and yeah, it really tasted like the dried up stuff scraped from the bottom of the container. 

Besides the disappointment I felt with the O-toro and the Uni there were a few items I was satisfied with. The third item I ordered was Amaebi. This looked a lot better and unlike other sushi restaurants the raw shrimp does come with the fried shrimp heads, which we felt unless they give you the fried shrimp heads with this dish then you are missing out. The shrimp heads were perfectly fried but of course they have trimmed its whiskers so there wasn't a lot of that to munch on. Our fourth dish was the Baked Mussels and is good and pretty standard compared to other Japanese restaurants with the exception of Sushi Zone, which does the Baked Mussels perfectly and above standard, well worth the wait. Our final dish was the raw oysters from Japan, the Shigoku oysters. These were good and I do recommend trying these. The oysters were clean, fresh, and sweet. They were garnished with a special sauce, fish eggs, and green onions. 

Overall, I will NOT be coming back. This is not my type of sushi restaurant where they mask the real flavors and colors of the seafood. If you liked sauced up sushi and half cooked seafood that your parents won't be too afraid to try then this is your place. But if you are into the raw, clean, and REAL sushi then go else where. Enjoy!
author: Nana R.

description: You must get the Money Roll! Yum squared. Good light Japanese beer too. It was a little warm temp wise, but the food is delicious!!
author: Jason S.

description: Betty sets the tone for Takara. Consistently good food, exceptional service. The space is small and there is a wait at times, but well worth it.
author: Russ E.

description: I came in for a casual sushi dinner and was absolutely blown away! The fish is incredibly fresh and it is not too crowded considering the small space. The Spunk Roll is delicious - a little spicy and refreshing because of the lemon. The Eggplant Special is also a fantastic appetizer. Overall, I was extremely satisfied and pleased with this neighborhood spot!
author: Alexandra A.

description: Great friendly service. I recommend the appetizers. The Spicy Tuna wrapped in Shiso and fried is exceptional along with the Shishito Peppers; hot and amazing!  The Fire Ball rolls are oh so good.  Love this place and the staff !
author: J B.

description: Someone's face actually lit up when they recommended this restaurant to me for dinner and I now know why! Friendly staff, quick service, great rolls for a good price.
author: Denise E.

description:
Best sushi in the Castro hands down. I come here every couple weeks and love it! Fresh fish and friendly staff. 
I love their Tokyo breeze and their specials are always on point
author: Chantel B.

description:
Check out the happy hour menu. 
Nigiri for $1.80/pc off the happy hour menu $3 big sapporo (DO NOT pass on the shiro maguro)
Dinner for two with drinks can run you $35 and that's if you over order. 
The quality of the fish is not degraded by the fact it's a happy hour menu. 
But be warned, 6pm is the cut off for happy hour. No wiggle room 
Sit at the bar and enjoy.
author: Bob H.

description: My friend and I had dinner here just before a show at the Castro Theater so we were pressed for time and weren't able to try much. The rolls were reasonably priced and tasty, but what stood out was the service. We were asked to move to another table to accommodate a larger group, which I didn't mind, and the server gave us a small sake for the trouble. I would return.
author: K P.

description: Takara is fantastic. The fish is incredibly fresh and the service is excellent. Have been coming here regularly since it opened and have never had a subpar experience. Have eaten at many sushi places in the city and in my experience, the only restaurants with better, fresher fish are Maruya and Kusakabe. Both way too pricey to be feasible for a normal San Franciscans weekly sushi habit. Takara is markedly better than plenty of sushi in the city with bigger price tags and is definitely the biggest bang for your buck. Highly recommend ordering off the specials list posted by the sushi bar.
author: Leah R.

description: Sushi is great. Awesome roll selection, fresh fish, reasonable prices- not too expensive. Came here on a Saturday night and was able to make a res day of. Also, staff is very attentive. :)
author: Sophie P.

description: I have been here many times and the soap, salad and tea is always very good. I have not had a bad item in a Benito box combination. I normally order a Benito Box expecting some of the items may not be good, so I have other items to fall back on. Here there has never been one single item that was not good or not hot enough or not made with fresh oil.
author: Laurel Z.

description: This place is so delicious.  I'm a big sushi fan!  I feel so lucky that I can walk here!
author: A K.

description:
My mom and I came here for my birthday dinner and it is officially our new favorite sushi restaurant!
We got the Tsunami Roll, the X-Roll, and the Tokyo Breeze roll.
All of them were delicious!
My mom loved the Tsunami roll- Unagi, unagi, and more unagi. And some cream cheese.
The stand-out for me was Tokyo Breeze.
Lemon in sushi!!!
Lemon, sea salt, and wasabi was the perfect combination.
It was light and refreshing and perfect!!!
We will absolutely be coming back here many times.

EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT!!!!
author: Ella H.

description:
Not the best sushi I've ever had in San Francisco but I have to say that Takara held it's own.  The servers were friendly considering the drunk messes that stumble in every so often. My friend and I had grabbed a couple drinks before stumbling in ourselves and the waitress treated us amazingly even helping us pick out the best rolls on the menu.  The water was flowing and the free edamame helped us get some food in our systems quick.

I recommend a longer dinning experience for anyone next time, but this place dropped the food off quick so we could get in and out. Takara is a nice little gem in the Castro.  I'll for sure be back.
author: Kevin J.

description: One of our favorite hood go to spots. Great service, fresh fish. Ask for the recommendations of the day to get the super fresh fish cuts. We had the king salmon nigiri and it was like butter. The toro with truffle salt was lovely but I didn't taste any truffle. Love their seaweed salad, which was complimented well by the house hot sake. Aloha roll was memorable. The volcano roll is a good one for crunchy fried sweet bits and Tokyo roll is super fresh with lemon and avocado. They are adamant about not using soy sauce on their pre sauced rolls. It's very sweet when a wait staff takes so much pride in their chefs' work. We always go back. Thanks Takara.
author: Audra S.

description:
I'm sad! What happened?!?! Tonight's food was horrible! 
We live less than a mile away and our food delivery arrived long after an hour had gone by. We ordered gyoza, a tempura hand roll, shrimp sashimi and a few other items. The gyoza tasted like it sat in the fridge, the tempura in the hand roll was stale, and for shrimp sashimi we receive shrimp nigiri. They were dismissive when we called to let them know! Really?!?! Who does that? 
We've eaten at all of their restaurants in the city and their food quality and poor service appear to be problematic at all of their locations. 
Another restaurant to cross off our list. I'm sad.
author: Denny L.

description: Takara Sushi focuses on serving only sustainably sourced fish.  So if there is a reason your regular favorite sushi isn't available, they'll make a recommendation of something similar that is approved by the Monterey Bay "Seafood Watch Program"  (http://www.montereybayaquarium.org/cr/seafoodwatch.aspx)  But meanwhile the presentation of this establishment is very artful as is the space itself.
author: Christopher A.

description:
this review is for the delivery service. 

long story short, ordered delivery through yelp/eat 24 with a 45-60 min wait. 

75 min go by, call and ask for status to which i get "they're on the way, 10-15 min"

another THIRTY min go by, still no order. i call to cancel (i have a show to catch and will have to skip out on dinner now). they show up as i was on the phone attempting to cancel. 

they're responses "sorry about that". no offers to take care of it in any way whatsoever. i of course had NO time to eat so i just tossed it.

a 45-60 min quote ended up taking about 1 hour and 45 min.
author: Sammi C.

description:
My sister and I came for dinner around 7:30 on Saturday night. It was empty when we arrived which made us a little nervous, but we decided to give it a shot. The restaurant did get significantly more crowded as it got a little later, but seems like at any time there's no wait for a table.

They brought out edamame and water as soon as we sat down which was nice. Then we had the kamikaze roll, x roll, salmon sashimi, and chicken udon.

The kamikaze roll was very good. I'm a big spicy tuna fan to begin with though! The x roll was also delicious, but I thought the sauce was overwhelming the rest of the roll. 

The salmon sashimi was super fresh, it's clear the quality of the fish is really good. 

The udon was fantastic too! The broth was amazingly flavorful and the noodles were perfectly cooked. The chicken in it was nothing to write home about. I'll probably try the beef next time. (Seafood is a little too adventurous for me...)

Service was just ok (hence just 4 stars instead of 5). Our waitress came by very quickly after we were seated and asked if we were ready to order. We told her we needed just another minute, but didn't see her for at least 10... Then, midway through our meal we overheard her telling the table next to us about some specials that weren't on the menu. We didn't hear about any specials...

Also, the water guy kept filling my glass. Literally every time I took a sip. It got to the point where it was actually disruptive to the conversation.

I don't mean to end on a negative note because this is a solid sushi place with some inventive rolls, tasty fresh fish, and friendly servers.
author: Rachel E.

description: Great little spot in the Castro. The potsickers and grilled jalapenos were very good. The service wasn't very good but the food made up for it. I would definitely go back again.
author: Chris Y.

description:
I am disappointed  with Takara's customer service and delivery this evening. I just ordered $60 worth of sushi and asked them to throw in some edamame (considering if you order from Grub Hub online, a minimum of $40, they give you free edamame) and the male staff member refused to give us edamame despite his knowledge of their having this offer through 3rd parties online. Edamame is free at the table when you visit the restaurant, so I don't understand what the big deal is. If he had offered me a double order of edamame, considering I'm more than a regular, I'd be writing a 5 star review right now, super happy.

Customer service 101.

Pissed and hungry and feeling robbed!

Think twice about ordering delivery.
author: Jordan Q.

description: Ate in at Takara and found it average.  Quality of their fish was good but not outstanding, with some being mediocre.  Food came quite slow even though the restaurant was only moderately busy.
author: Adrian K.

description:
Up all night with a burning sensation in my stomach. This is the only thing that would have upset me because it was out of my normal routine. It was overpriced, the decor was a little run down, and the server was attentive but overwhelmed.
I will not be back.
author: S. M.

description: Great Sushi spot in the Castro. The rolls are creative and delicious and the prices are average. The service and environment are equally as great. I found our servers to be attentive and adorable in how willing they were to please. Easily one of my fave Sushi spots in the city and I'll definitely be back. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description: I decided to check out this place after reading some other decent yelp reviews. It is fairly small but has a good evening ambiance. Our waiter was timely and overall service was great. I ordered the SF Roll and it was pretty good although not what I expected. The pieces seemed a bit smaller than what I can otherwise find for the same price. Not a great place for large groups. There were about 6 of us total but we managed to fit in a corner. I wouldn't recommend going with more than 4 people. It was a nice place to try but probably wouldn't end up coming here again.
author: April W.

description: Best sushi restaurant ever. The mood there is nice. Perfect for a date. Dinosaur rolls were orgasmic. I would recommend a place at the bar then you can watch the creation of these amazing sushi. I have been to a lot of sushi restaurants in the US, in France and in Japan and this one is one the best I have tried.
author: Ruijan M.

description:
Since going vegan late last year, I've been hesitant to go out to Japanese food since sashimi was a weakness of mine. Boy am I glad I went to Takara!! We were in the Castro to see a movie and only had about 45 minutes to eat. We were seated right away and served edamame and tea. I was a little disappointed in the lack of vegetarian options on the menu, however they had a dragon roll and we had to try it! We also ordered a few other rolls, some veggie tempura and a wakame salad.

Our food came out pretty quickly and it was all very tasty. The vegetarian dragon roll is to DIE for! Tempura tofu fills the roll and it's topped with Japanese eggplant and avocado, AMAZING! I told my husband I could just order dragon rolls on our next visit and be very happy! On top of the really awesome food, our service was friendly and prompt.  The sashimi options looked really good as well. If you're a vegan/vegetarian, I highly recommend this place! There aren't too many options, however, the ones on the menu are so worth checking this place out for.  It was pretty affordable, too, around $50 for two people (including beer).
author: Rachael J.

description: Reasonable prices, quality selection. The salmon sampler was particularly savory, as was The Bomb entree.
author: Matthew V.

description: Nice lunch specials with a decent variety. Specialty sushi rolls are moderately priced. Biggest downside is that the service was slow even with many open tables. The restaurant itself is cute and in a nice little spot in the castro.
author: Stephen S.

description:
I had a great experience here a couple of nights ago. (Mama Ji's was a madhouse, so we decided to try this place instead.)

There were three of us and they seated us right away. They gave us a good amount of time to absorb the menu (many options), and were on the whole very attentive.
