I ordered the Tempura Udon and the Beef Tataki. Both were really tasty. The udon noodles were light and had a great texture. The tempura was fried perfectly - not greasy at all. The tataki was just plain delicious. 

The price was right as well.

I live in the neighborhood and only frequent 5 or 6 places for dinner as many of the options here aren't very good. I was really, really impressed with this place and it's now on my list of go-to places in the Castro.
author: Michael T.

description: I ordered a salmon lover , it came with a paper thin salmon on top and no other fish. Overall I paid almost $60 per person and I found the fish portions very cheap
author: ferhat n.

description: Takara committed to a 45-60min delivery. My food was over an hour late. When I called, their manager was rude and unapologetic. I received the order and the food was underwhelming. I would not order from them again.
author: Marc L.

description: This place is consistently good. My roommates and I have a sushi delivery addiction and Takara satisfies our cravings on a weekly basis. Sometimes the delivery takes a while, but hey, that's what you get when you're too lazy to go to the restaurant I guess. Our staples are tokyo breeze, x roll, and maguro ngiri.
author: Ilana B.

description:
TOTALLY MY NEW SUSHI PLACE IN SF! :)

Visited this place a couple of times with my friends when I was visiting SF...and it never disappoint me or my friends.  We all love it!

Totally coming back next time I visit SF again!  
Keep up the good work guys!
author: Anna N.

description:
Favorite part was the dancing spicy shrimp. They weren't actually very spicy but the tempura batter was perfect.

Tokyo breeze was ok...surprise roe on top that we had been trying to avoid...:/

Also tried the yummy roll and it was pretty good.

Nothing too amazing but no wait on a Saturday night and good service. mmmmm Tempura.
author: Christine H.

description:
We came here for my mom's annual bday unagi donburi dinner, and my mom's hell bent on trying to find her ultimate unagi donburi experience in San Francisco. I had hoped this year unlike the other 2 years, we'd hit gold at Takara's, but, nope, it's strike three :( . At $18 a bowl, you'd think my mom would have at least liked something about the dish, but she disliked everything about it. She said the rice wasn't the short grain sushi type rice, and she got the tail end of the unagi with lots of bones and burnt bits on the edges, and not enough unagi sauce flavoring throughout the dish. Sigh...this pretty much sucks.

My caterpillar sushi roll on the other hand was tasty. I like how they use the bigger tobiko eggs instead of the tiny ones. I would have liked more unagi sauce drizzled on the bottom. It was rather skimpy, kinda like their unagi portions in it too. The good part is the fresh avocado on top. Very nice.

Jolene L. ordered 2 Aloha rolls specials...her favorite by far. It had sashimi tuna poke, and that's as much as ingredients I can remember...we also ordered the green tea ice cream served in a giant martini glass. I usually like green tea, but I thought it had a weird aftertaste finish, like eating a mouthful of lavender flowers. Yuck. At least my mom and Jolene L. ate it all. 

The wait staff was efficient, friendly and helpful which earns the extra star. They consistently gave great water and tea service. Parking is metered streets.

I am now in my mom's black list books... I can't go through another year giving her meh to blah unagi rice bowls for her birthday, I mean, what does it say when she'd rather eat unagi out of a tin can!?
author: Pauline L.

description:
One of my favorite sushi spots.  Great service, chill atmosphere, super fresh fish.  I've been there a lot, it helps because it's close to my house, but there are 3 other sushi spots close and they don't compare to Takara.
My picks are the Japonese Roll, Heads Will Roll, chicken katsu, and all the nigiri is awesome.
author: Jason D.

description: Great Sushi - loved the nigiri. The atmosphere is very authentic and wonderful
author: Katie P.

description:
A little underwhelmed by both the food and the service.

Although we were seated promptly after walking in, we weren't given menus. We waited several minutes while talking but menus didn't arrive; we tried catching the attention of a server but ended up grabbing menus from a neighboring table.

The dinosaur roll was disappointing: the coating on the soft shell crab was thick and overcooked, overpowering the taste of the crab. The summer roll was okay, but not overly memorable.
author: Glen G.

description:
Why is there such huge rating inflations for Asian food in the Castro? It's so terrible. Mama Ji's is overpriced and bad, and this place is no different.

I got the Tokyo Breeze, which had pretty good reviews on Yelp. It had avocado and lemon with tuna on top. They also season the roll with sesame oil and salt, which I thought was interesting. It tasted really weird though. The tuna was fresh, but the lemon just completely threw off the taste of the roll. It was incredibly sour. My friend had a bite of mine and made a weird face. It's very unexpectedly sour so beware. 

My friend got the chicken teriyaki dinner plate. It was very meh. Just a ton of chicken with rice and a side salad and miso soup. No cooked veggies or any kind of garnish.

We also got beer-- they have Asahi Black!!! If you've never tried it before, you have to get it. They poured it into this long fancy cup which looked nice. When we were done, we each asked for another one, and the waitress only came out with one beer
and strangely, she poured half into each of our cups and walked away before we could ask for another one... This was super weird. It's as if she was trying to restrict our alcohol consumption or something lol. We definitely made it really clear that we each wanted another beer... why would we want to share one???! On top of that, she immediately came out with the check which made us uncomfortable since we just got our drinks and wanted to enjoy it. And then 5 minutes later (we hadn't paid yet), she came back to our table and was like oops sorry and took the check away and then brought it back a couple of minutes later. I assume she forgot to add the beer in there or something.

Anyway, this was a super weird experience and a pretty mediocre meal. Only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one is because they have Asahi Black.
author: Christina L.

description:
If I could give this place a 10, I totally would. My boyfriend and I started going here about 6 months ago and have been going about twice a month ever since. The server and the sushi chef are incredibly nice and helpful and always seem excited to see us and ask how we've been. They always recommend something new and have yet to disappoint us. 
Two standout dishes are the Volcano Roll, which is eel with an amazing crunchy panko, and the Albacore Carpaccio is fresh and delicious. And yay they start delivering next month!!! So needless to say I love love love.
author: Diana B.

description: Average sushi.   Nothing to really come back to. I give it 3 stars as the staff was very accommodating to us as they wanted to close the restaurant.
author: Marck N.

description: Delicious sushi spot. I'm not in the castro too often, actually, NEVER. But discovered this place while walking by with a friend and decided to check it out after a long day of grocery shopping at Whole Foods. The summer roll was very fresh and the bomb was delicious.
author: Carrie Y.

description: I LOVE this Sushi restaurant. It looks like a hole in the wall but the fish tastes fresh, and the place has a happy vibe.
author: Morris R.

description: Beginning at the miso, it had a more complex flavor than most. Really delicious. We stuck to sashimi for the most part-- great selection and extremely fresh. You can't miss the white tuna. I forget the exact name but it is snow white and super fatty. Amazing. Hamachi and Japanese uni were also incredible.
author: Lisa W.

description: I'm certain that my recent food poisoning incident stemmed from this place.  At the very least, don't get sushi delivery from here on a Sunday.  So traumatizing.
author: Melanie M.

description:
I really wanted to be blown away by Takara in the Castro.  My favorite Japanese restaurant closed in 2013 (was in the Mission) and I've been searching for one to take it's place ever since.  Quality and consistency of food, service, neighborhood and environment/customers are all factors.  

Dined at Takara on four occasions in the past 90 days - twice alone and twice with friends.  Each time I had a mix of sashimi and nigiri.  There are definite trends of strengths and needs-improvement.

Strengths:

1. Quality of food - yummy!  This includes sashimi and nigiri, plus food from the kitchen and sushi rolls, which my dining companions ordered and I tasted.  

2. Friendly staff - warm, welcoming and not overbearing (more on this below)

3. Environment - the feeling in the restaurant is always relaxed, fun and unpretentious

4. Price - totally fair considering all factors

5. Takes reservations - recommended, and totally appreciated by me.  (I believe strongly that San Francisco restaurants not accepting reservations are taking advantage of their diners in order to 'gin up' hype about popularity by artificially creating long lines, and/or are just lazy. Really - accepting reservations in the age of cloud services, such as Open Table, is inexpensive and requires minimal IT infrastructure or no IT knowledge.)

Needs-improvement:

1. Sashimi and nigiri portion size - fish is cut consistently too small; considerably smaller than it should be, even considering the fair price.  

2. Uneven service - either too much or too little attention.  And surprisingly, some of the staff provide inaccurate information about the fresh fish available on a given day from the Sushi chef, or the number of pieces in sashimi and nigiri portions.

I do hope management takes action on the items needing improvement.  I will update this review if things get consistently better in both areas.   Until then, the search continues....
author: Sc. S.

description:
I got take out from Takara last weekend and was very happy overall with this small sushi restaurant in my new neighborhood.  

We ordered the volcano roll which I really enjoyed.  We also got a California roll, tempura roll and goyza.  Everything tasted good and was definitely fresh, we especially enjoyed the rolls with tempura.  

The staff was very nice.  The only downside was we had to wait 15 minutes for our order once we arrived to pick it up and the restaurant was cramped with no where to stand.
author: John S.

description: Excellent black cod and grilled hamachi.  Rock and roll was only decent.  Red bean ice cream was reasonably good.  The yellow pickled vegetable was very good.
author: Niniane W.

description: Unremarkable... Sushi no better than what you could buy next door at Mollie Stone. Location feels a bit run down, green tea and service were both good. Left kind of disappointed by the fish though, wanting better so went elsewhere the next day.
author: I Love S.

description: Not bad! I'm picky when it comes to my sushi and Takara impressed me. My girlfriend and I got some nigiri- Hotate (scallop), Maguro (tuna), Flying Fish roe, and Tako (octopus). SO amazing delicious. The scallop and tuna were our favorites- the fish was super fresh and tasted perfect. Also we ordered the fatty tuna w/green onion roll and the Volcano. Order the Volcano - it's beautiful and well worth the $12. We also got miso soup- I wasn't a fan.. I had to ask twice for it and when we got it, it was kinda watery and tasteless. But my lady disagreed - she liked it. Either way- the fish is what we came for and we were overall impressed. Great service - we were seated immediately and given menus, drinks were fast, food was good. Definitely a place worth checking out! :)
author: Ashley F.

description:
Went here for dinner late on a Saturday night. 
It's a cute, small place that randomly plays top 40 dance music? Probably an influence of being located in the heart of the Castro.

I had the gyoza, which was totally standard and satisfactory. 
I also had the Volcano Roll which is served in a giant heap covered in delicious crunchy temporar shavings and a spicy-esqe sauce. The menu lists mango...but I did not taste/see any mango on the dish. 

My mother sister bother ordered the sea bass and raved about it. 
We ordered the house hot saki which was decent. 

Would definitely go back when in the mood for good, classic sushi.
author: Chloé M.

description: Found this place on Yelp today.  Got there by 9:00PM.  Was about to be seated by server but owner/manager instructed her to turn us away.  She cited that they were closed even though the sign on the door and info on Yelp say they are closed at 9:30PM.  I pointed that out and server just said they are too busy so closing early.  BIG LET DOWN!  Will never return.  Drove all this way for nothing.  Wasted gas.  Wasted time.  What a waste!  Would give it a zero star if allowed.
author: Sue N.

description: We eat here probably once a week and think it's excellent. I'd recommend the crazy roll, snow crab leg, red dragon and definitely an Asahi Black for the beer drinkers. Staff are attentive and the sushi is always immaculately presented. Can get busy but they do take reservations.
author: Paul P.

description:
Takara Sushi prepares the best sushi in the Castro, hand(job)s down! The place is petite, so not recommended for groups over 6, but everything from the welcome, the complimentary edamame, to the unwritten sake menu, and even the misspelled "dessert" header is awesome. 

I really enjoy the rolls here - there's most of your typical rolls and a few specialty/proprietary rolls mixed in! I don't find the prices too expensive, but I guess others do? There aren't a lot of special discounts and maybe that's the reason.. 

Definitely a great casual date spot or sex-in-the-city boys-night-out place!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Great sushis, but kind of pricy!

I always pick up the food, but the place is nice too, and the waitresses are super-nice!
author: Nathan B.

description:
Ordered delivery.  Sushi and rolls were mediocre.  Delivery was in an hour as promised.  Probably wouldn't order from here again.

Dining in might be different?
author: K V.

description:
So excited to have a GREAT sushi place in my new neighborhood! 
Fresh, great menu choices, yum. 
Spunk roll was fantastic!
author: G W.

description:
I often get delivery from Takara Sushi and it definitely deserves five shiny stars!

Food - Blow me away everytime
Service - Impeccable, deliveries are always on time
Price - Very reasonable

Just like other reviewers have mentioned, the fish here is extremely fresh. As for the rolls, I highly recommend Spunk and The Bomb (live true to its name). If you are in the mood for something warm, then you can't go wrong with the eggplant special or spicy dancing shrimp!
author: Jacky Z.

description: Our plate of complimentary edamame had 9 pieces. When the guest next to us sat down, they were given an entire bowl. The "hot" tea was room temperature and wasn't stepped long enough. My refill later was hot, but again flavorless. Yes, I know these two things were "free", but my thing is, if you're going to do it, do it right and be consistent. Although the servers were friendly, they came around way too much refilling our drinks. Different servers came by one after the other every 3 minutes. The Pumpkin, Salmon Lover, Hamachi Nigiri, and the Maguro Tataki Salad were all delicious. However, I felt the Pumpkin was overpriced. They could have also been a little more generous with the size of the Salmon Lover. 3.5/4 stars overall.
author: Melanie N.

description: Our favorite sushi place in SF, and we've been to a lot.  The sushi is always spectacular, and the staff couldn't be nicer.  Betty, one of the main waitresses, might well be elected the next mayor, judging by how many guests she seems to know well.  And the main sushi chef, Trevor, is clearly a pro by any standard.
author: Adam F.

description:
Food: King CA roll with real crab was good, but the chicken teriyaki was drowning in bland, watery sauce and sesame seed.

Staff:  Friendly, but I'm not sure if they're Japanese.

Environment:  Small space and loud.
author: Jerico P.

description:
The best little sushi shop in the Castro. I think the best thing about this place is the woman who does a lot of the waiting. She's super friendly and helpful. If you're vegetarian or vegan, let her know early on, and she'll make suggestions. There are some vegetarian specials (or vegetarian versions of specials) that aren't on the board.

Your meal will start off right with some bottomless green tea and some edamame. Delicious. My suggestion is peruse the menu for one or two things, but then let your appetite follow the specials.
author: Douglas P.

description:
I've had both lunch and dinner here six times in the past year...and plan to keep going!

Ambiance:  Warm and relaxed.

Service: Friendly and very accommodating for food allergies.

Food (gluten-free dairy-free perspective): The freshness of the seafood can be hit or miss but always within the range of fresh.  My favorite roll is the Tokyo Breeze.  I also order the Takami Edamame with olive oil instead of butter.  The wait staff is always very accommodating, willing to modify rolls or let you know which rolls are standard gluten-free.  They also provide gluten-free tamari soy sauce.
author: G B.

description: Bday lunch with a close girl friend - had the kumomoto oysters (delicious!), aloha roll (escolar on top was fantastic!), scallop roll and Sumner roll were yummy too. Fresh fish at a reasonable price is hard to find even in SF and theirs lived up to expectations. Will be coming back.
author: Melanie O.

description: I've eaten here in the past and the sushi was quite good. Tonight, however, we ordered delivery and nearly two hours later we are still waiting for our food. To keep a long story short, we have had various delivery status updates, last of which was that they "never received our order." It's now 9:12pm and we have no dinner. I wouldn't advise ordering delivery from Takara.
author: Lisa F.

description: Best sushi I ever tasted in my life come here once a month from Pittsburg ca to eat food is great location is awesome too very friendly people :)
author: Ramon N.

description:
Delicious, quality sushi, and yummy Japanese dishes. The staff is very friendly, especially the owner, Betty. Wonderful restaurant to bring good company and enjoy the amazing food.

pricing it not to bad as well, very affordable.
author: Motoe N.

description: The sushi here is always really fresh. The only downfall is some of the rolls could use a little more fish inside. we ordered a spicy scallop roll and the scallop portion was quite small you almost couldnt taste it. The service is super friendly and super duper speedy though!
author: Ryan S.

description:
A fine sushi restaurant indeed.  Wait staff was attentive and quick.  Sushi and sashimi was delicious and very creative.  You can see and taste the freshness.  My favorate dish is the monk fish liver, aka Ankimo.  I can eat that stuff all day everyday.  Loved the oyster on a half shell.  Sweet and meaty with a tangy sauce.  Tried a beef tataki which was light and amazing.  

If you're not familiar with Japanese food or want to venture away from the usual stuff, ask the waitress to decide for you and prepare your palettes for a very good time.
author: Eric C.

description: My favorite sushi restaurant! Never hits a wrong note, always fresh, friendly staff, nice cozy dining room. One thing to note: Though the hours aren't listed, THEY ARE OPEN FOR LUNCH! Give Takara a try--you'll love it!
author: BG S.

description:
Love this place!!!  I live about a block away and have walked by many times. For some reason I was hesitant to try it. It can't be that good if it's so convenient, right??? Same premise as if it's too good to be true, it probably is. Wrong!!!  

The service is fast and friendly, the sushi is fresh and yummy, the presentation is creative, and the ambiance is cute. I keep seeing the sushi chef put out one gorgeous roll after another and I want to try them all!!!  My sake sashimi basically melted in my mouth. I got miso soup with clams, which was tasty, followed by Takara special and salmon skin hand roll. I really liked all of it.  Yes, this girl can eat a lot!!!  Don't judge, don't judge...I know where the gym is ;-). 

While it is still not my favorite sushi place in the City, I must say that I will make this my favorite neighborhood sushi joint. Can't wait to return!!!
author: Marina S.

description: Been here more than a few times, and every time is better than the last. Close proximity to my house and the Castro, the service is always impeccable and the fish is the freshest. Dragon roll and the X roll are my two favorites! Definitely one of the more attentive and affordable sushi spots in the neighborhood (:
author: Erin M.

description:
My fav Sushi spot if you want a chill, cozy atmosphere with sophistication...

BEST ROLLS!!

Tokyo Breeze
Fire Cracker
Volcano Roll

Love this place, never lets me down.
author: Rollio R.

description:
a wonderful Japanese place in the hood! I have been always skeptical about restaurants in the Castro but this place proved me totally wrong.

my friend and I decided to go for Omakase and for 100$ for two, this turned out to be one of the best deals I had ever had.

it was a 8-course tasting menu with all kinds of interesting sea food with great execution from the chef.

this is a must-try!
author: Sung C.

description: Recently, we were out and stumbled upon Takara Sushi! The vibe is relaxed, inviting and friendly. Great service and beautiful presentation throughout our meal. So, check out Takara the next time you are in the Castro!
author: Paul R.

description: Sushi was great! Got a rainbow roll, nigi maki, and a "love roll". All the fish was delicious, and the rolls were nice and right. So many different roll combinations! The ambiance was pretty but the music was loud and too up beat for sushi. The best part was the service...very quick but not in a rushing us out the door way.
author: Jordan S.

description:
I'd love to give Takara 5 stars, but objectively speaking I feel that rating has to be reserved for some very special sushi. However, this place is fabulous - not least of the reasons being the super-sweet waitress who has been here most of the dozen or so times we've dined here. 

The sushi is invariably fresh and the portions are generous. Their prices are reasonable, and their fresh-list is usually populated by good 'ol standbys vs. an overabundance of pricey, esoteric parts of pricey, esoteric fish. 

Nigiri size can fluctuate a little, as can the the rolls, depending on the chef. However we have NEVER had a tough, smelly, dry, or otherwise unappetizing piece of fish here. 

I can't speak for many of the entree items, but the gyoza are solid and the sunomono cucumber salad is a favorite. 

Beyond the food, the staff is genuinely warm and friendly, and will remember you if you come in a second time. 

By far the best Sushi in the Castro - don't even think of going to Osaka (waay overpriced, inferior atmosphere), Barracuda (meh) or All Seasons (poor quality, usually lots of high-school kids doing sake bombs in the background) before/instead of here.
author: Haley B.

description:
well well well Takara, i ate in person once and i ordered 6 times via eat24 and the last two were bad.

i didn't complain about my 5th order but today the 6th draws the line. They have been getting progressively worse and people should know.

we ordered
Tokyo breeze - had old avocado, tuna was not too good on it
old avocado here http://imgur.com/QpYMnUh
King California Roll - good
Dragon Roll - decent
Salmon lover - yuck fish tasted odd and we did not finish

i dont understand why take out customers get crappy food. 

Don't order take out from here they won't give you good food, probably saved it for the restaurant.
author: Dennis K.

description:
Had a to-go order with 4 friends that we picked up. Can't say that all of us were impressed. The to-go orders seemed to be lacking food... For as much as we paid, we had hoped we'd get fairly good portions - that wasn't the case.

The california rolls were definitely plan, the chicken katsu only tasted good because of the sauce and the small itsy bitsy salad was meh.

I hope they give a little more thought to to-go orders in the future.
author: Matthew H.

description:
This place's alluring exterior helped it make my list of places I must try. And I finally got to one afternoon, when I went for lunch. And sadly, it will be my last visit to Takara Sushi because it's just not worth a return visit.

My objection is not to their fish, which is the best I've had in the neighborhood. It was fresh and generally delicious. But they are stingy! 

Their rolls are cut very small, so that each individual sushi peace is about a centimeter shorter than what is standard. I've noticed lower-end restaurants do this so that they can still give you six pieces, but they save on sunk costs by using less fish. But Takara is not a lower-end place: one roll was $6 and their special rolls were in the $9-$14 range. Their special rolls are also not much larger than a standard roll, so I have a hard time accounting for the price differential.

Finally, this place lost me because I left hungry after spending $35 for lunch. While their fish might be better than their local competitors, they give you so little of it that I'm not sure it's worth the trade off.
author: P Z.

description: We live around the corner and Takara is our go to sushi restaurant - we love it. The staff are super friendly and knowledgeable, after the first couple of times we went in they would remember our drinks order, favourite rolls etc..  We have been back many times, and the rolls are the stand out. The volcano, spunk, SF, and fireball are amazing, but everything we have had has been good. Having visited with a gluten-free friend we found them excellent at identifying what she could/couldn't eat which was fantastic.  We'll keep going back!
author: Sian S.

description: Excellent food, friendly attentive staff - terrific addition to the neighborhood!
author: Crispin H.

description:
So so...

I enjoyed walking in to this quaint little spot. I'd love to give them a higher rating. But it just wasn't filling enough. Portions are on the smaller side, and prices are on the steeper side. Not an ideal combo.

I ordered a california hand roll and another roll i can't remember the name of. Everything tasted adequate, but our table required a 2nd round of orders too get full. $90 later, we were done. 

While I enjoyed everything, it didn't blow me away for how much I had to pay.
author: Jon C.

description:
Takara is the absolute best sushi in San Francisco and probably anywhere.  The staff are super friendly and always aim to please.  They've only been open 2 months so far and are very eager to strut their stuff in the local restaurant scene.  

Quick Tips...

1. They're closed on Tuesdays.
2.  Have the Firecracker roll if you dig spicy + sushi.
3.  The Volcano roll is also super fantastic.

LOVE this place!
author: Jason C.

description:
A few months ago I broke down and went back to Takara - it's so convenient, and my sons love gyoza and sushi.  I was pleasantly surprised by how much it's improved.  I can't speak to the SF roll, since I usually get their chirashi-don, but their fish is consistently fresh and tasty, and their chirashi always has something new and interesting on it.  We usually do take out, but the servers are always wonderful with my sons, offering them water and edamame if we have to wait for our order to be ready.  

So: Go Takara!  I take back my two star review - you're my go-to take out sushi place in our 'hood!
author: Lily T.

description:
The spousal unit and I have been searching (and searching) for a new favorite sushi place for a couple years. We've finally found it! 

The sushi is great, the prices are great and the service is great. We've been here six times and each time it's been a perfect sushi experience.

The seating is superior. Unlike most San Francisco restaurants, which force you to sit next to your neighbors (and keep your conversation clean),  most of the seating has high wall dividers. Yay, privacy!  There's also seating in the sushi bar area if you want something more social. There's a big teevee over the chef's head and lots of people come in to get sushi, get blasted on saki and watch whatever game is on. 

Remember to wash your hands before you eat - the bathroom has one of the most interesting faucets I've ever seen and it's worth checking out.
author: Tim W.

description:
From the second I walked in, everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. I ordered all vegetarian dishes to go. While I waited they brought me green tea (on the house) and the woman informed me that they can make custom veggie rolls!

Ohitashi: very fresh and flavorful
Cucumber Sunomono: it tasted as good as it looked!
Veggie Tempura Roll wrapped in soy-paper: My new favorite roll!

Everything was packaged very carefully.

This is a great neighborhood spot I will return to over and over again. I am excited to learn they deliver as well.
author: Alex M.

description: Excellent fresh food, delivered in 1 hr exactly.  Udon and sushi special were terrific, big portions, and well prepared.
author: Jerry R.

description:
Really great sushi!  I have only gotten delivery from here, so my review is solely for the food.  Last Saturday night, we were exhausted and craving sushi and scoured Yelp looking for a decent place that would deliver. We stumbled onto Takara and were pleased to see they delivered until 10:30 (though Yelp said they are only open until 9:30!  Glad we called!), since we have seen this place before and were curious to try it.

We ordered the following:

Tuna sashimi with fried onions: OMFG, amazing!!  The fish was delicious, tender and fresh.  It melted in our mouths!

Spicy tuna on crispy rice: I LOVE this stuff.  This is one of the things I miss most about getting sushi in LA and was very pleased that, not only does Takara make this, but it makes it well!

Yellowtail and scallion roll: Fresh and delicious!  Very simple, but quite good:)

My only gripe is that the portions are small compared to the price.  This place is quite pricey (that all came out to $30, and we were not stuffed), but it's good enough that I would love to eat/order from Takara again!
author: Julie S.

description:
Four-and-a-half wonderful stars.  This place is great!!!

I've been here more than a handful of times now, and it has been nothing but wonderfully consistent.  

If you are a fan of HAMACHI KAMA, this is your place.  I was craving this dish, and it did what I wanted it to do--melted in my mouth with my nice cold beer.  I was also  very pleased with the rolls we ordered.  I love that the fresh fish is the mainstay of the rolls and not some fancy (or un-fancy) sauce or over-abundance of rice.  The presentation is beautiful. 

Why this place is not packed on a Thursday night, I don't know!  The service in the past and tonight has been a bit slow (hence, the half star deduction), but very friendly.  Otherwise, everything else is exactly what you would want in a great sushi place.  And more.  

By the way, a great place to catch up with friends.  You can actually hear the person sitting across from you loud and clear.  Unlike other sushi places. .  (umami sushi).
author: Eugenia W.

description:
This is the best sushi I have ever had and I have been eating sushi since I was a kid.  

The fish is extremely fresh.  I have seen them cutting it right at the bar.  

The albacore melts in your mouth.  Betty (the cute server) is the sweetest little thing and they are quick on the drink refills.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Super friendly staff in this small and warm sushi place.

You must tried their volcano roll.  Its a must order dish in this lovely place. (I saw this dish on every table)
author: Raging D.

description:
im not really sure what to say other than i love this place more than most sushi places ive ever been to... ive been to maybe 20+ sushi bars, and this one is definitely on my top 3. i come here every week, sometimes twice a week. i dont really know what else to say other than i have nothing bad to say? 

verdict- awesome place, definitely recommend to ANYONE...
author: Justin O.

description:
I really love this place.  At first blush, it does not seem to be kid-friendly.  But the staff is so very friendly and kind to my almost two year old daughter.  Thankfully, she has a varied palate and eats up the wakame salad, sunomono, beef short ribs, soft shell crab and amazingly delicious misoyaki sea bass.

For the adults, the sushi is grade A. I was a little skeptical at first b/c the chef and staff are Chinese and not Japanese, which is always not a good sign for a sushi restaurant.  But I was wonderfully surprised at the quality of the sushi.  Very very good.

This is my go to restaurant for sushi in the city, and not just b/c we live nearby.  

I would highly recommend Takara Sushi.
author: R. K.

description:
I have been blessed to live on top of this restaurant, and have already sampled their food.  One word; Fabulous, tasty (oops that's two).

It is run by a great group of people.  They are friendly and courteous.

Do check them out!  You won't be disappointed.
author: Doug L.

description:
Grand Opening Saturday Night!  Welcome them to the neighborhood!  

Business Hours:
Mon - Sun 11:30am - 2:30pm
                     4:30pm - 9:30pm

HAPPY HOUR  4:30pm - 6:00pm!
I can't wait!
author: Clay K.

description:
Based simply on the quality of the fish, this is a 5 star.  It really might have been the best sushi I have had outside of Tokyo.
Prices are reasonable. Portions were good.  But it is the freshness and butter textures that really make this a worthy destination.
author: Tony D.

description: Fish was fresh, rice was nice, vegetarian options were plenty. Miso was spot on. Japanese beer on tap, what else do you want? Much better and cheaper than Ino sushi, which has glaring reviews. I"M A FAN!
author: Ed P.

description: Excellent!  Very knowledgable waitress, couldn't remember what I liked and she knew by the description I gave her.  The best I've had of all my favorites rolls, thank you!  Can't wait to bring my friends.
author: Skindy B.

description: No substitutions in the bento boxes. I asked to substitute a simple cucumber only roll in place of the California roll and was swiftly denied saying it was preset. This makes me suspicious that the bento boxes are premade. Or at least the components are. Other than that the price was very cheap for a large amount of food. Would return just because of price.. They also play very loud electronic music in the dining room.
author: Rae T.

description:
Cute little place with tasteful decor and great service - the waitress is super knowledgeable and kept her wits about her while my lovely, but relentlessly high-maintenance friend asked a thousand questions about the food.
Delicious, fresh sushi and fried dishes - try the breaded mussels!
Only pet peeve: music is loud and BAD, not really conducive to the otherwise laid-back and comfortable atmosphere. Also: beware the water boy. He will fill and fill and refill your glass every chance he gets. Great for the thirsty. Less so for the easily quaffed (and annoyed).
author: Eva L.

description: I get a bento box for lunch about 2/3 times a week there, great place, great price.
author: Pierre H.

description:
I went here on my last vacation to San Francisco and it was great. My boyfriend and I love sushi and in the past year and a half have been to about 20 sushi places, so when we were planning our first night I tore through multiple reviews trying to find a great restaurant to try. 

The fish was very fresh, possibly the freshest sushi I've ever had. Once you develop a taste for sushi you can really tell the difference in the quality of the fish and learn how much that matters. That was the biggest selling point and one of the reasons I'm giving them a 4 star review. 

The service was good, but in the tradition of Asian restaurants it was very hands off. They brought what we needed when we flagged them down, although they might have been more attentive if we'd come earlier. We were the last customers to arrive so they were closing down as we ate.

The flavors of the rolls weren't the most creative I've ever had. There could have been more variety and more flavor. That's really what lost them the last star and was the major drawback.

Castro is always a great neighborhood to wander around before and after dinner, very cute and entertaining-as long as you're open-minded.

I'd suggest it, but not worth a trip specifically to Castro if you wouldn't enjoy the area.
author: Alicia C.

description: Sushi was pretty decent. its a small cute place. The tv playing sports def detracts from the boutique atmosphere. service was friendly although somewhat clueless... I think my server took a break right after dropping off my food and didnt check back with me... I waited  another 20 mins before I could order more food. otherwise, it prolly the best sushi in castro..happy hour is great. I'll be back
author: Cake W.

description:
They deliver! And their online ordering system is so clear and detailed! I was able to add comments and edits to each dish ordered. Everything was seamless. 

The hamachi was very good. The other rolls were okay, but I think I ordered things I don't like, so for what it was, it was great. They also labeled each of the rolls in the container. 

I love this place!
author: T G.

description:
This place has no seating, it is overly quiet, and is by far the smallest restaurant I have ever dined in....

But I really couldn't care less because their sushi is absolutely unrealistically DELICIOUS!!

PROS:

1. Love their comp edamame they give you upon seating (they will refuse to give a refill ..bah
2. THEIR VOLCANO ROLL IS THE MOST DELICIOUS THING MY MOUTH HAS EVER TASTED!!!!! From the crispness of the tempura to the juiciness and freshness of the sushi, to the wonderful presentation... SOOOO GOOD
3.their Philly roll is super yummy as well as their avocado roll...

CONS:
1. How can this joint not have HAPPY HOUR!!! Wtf. What a disappointment...
2. Location is very small and cozy and the awkward silence does not help... It's called music and you simply hit the ON button.

But again I really don't care.. This place deserves 5 stars all the way. Thank your VOLCANO roll. Best in town.
author: NC B.

description: a little pricey but you want good sushi? This is it Excellent service excellent staff
author: Mike N.

description: The sushi was good. Expensive. The service was not amazing. The price should not be what it is for the taste of the food. Not gonna make this a top choice for sushi.
author: Diego L.

description: Very very small delivery area! Would not deliver to  Divisadero / Haight area, all of a 2 minute drive. Great food.. I've eaten there, but unless you're within 3 feet of the restaurant... Go there.
author: Jason M.

description: The Fire Cracker roll was amazing, fried goodness. I can't believe I ate two of them, neither could the waitress.
author: L D.

description: I have walked by this place a hundred times, finally tried it on a Sunday night and all I can say is WOW!  The restaurant is cozy and comfortable, the staff was helpful and courteous, and the sushi was AMAZING. Whatever else you get, try the Aloha Roll and don't ruin it with soy sauce because it is perfect!
author: Jose H.

description: Great sushi and friendly fun staff! I was walking by and decided to stop in for my first visit. I was greeted like I had been there many times. The service was fast and sushi very fresh!!
author: Douglas H.

description:
I finally tried Takara tonight.  I was seated across the aisle from a table of about eight twentysomethings who were inordinately loud and who spent 'way too much time discussing who had vomited and passed out on New Year's Eve.  If the servers had asked this table to keep their voices down a bit I would have been grateful, but that may be asking too much.   Unfortunately, it did not make for a pleasant dining experience.

Takara was a mixed bag for me.  There were two servers, a man and a woman, who seemed to alternate at my table.  I ordered sushi and miso soup.  I began to become uncomfortable when I had to remind the waitress twice about the soup.  After a long wait in which no one appeared to give me more tea or bring my soup, the sushi finally arrived.  I reminded the male server--this is three times now--about the @$!! miso soup.  He produced a bowl quickly, but I should have just canceled it.

The sushi was good and the presentation was lovely.  It is, as others have observed, on the price-y side.  Both the tea and the soup were very watery--the tea so much that I would have taken it for hot water if I hadn't seen it poured.

I'll be back, particularly since I live two blocks away and I would love dearly for Takara to tighten things up a bit.  If they do, I hope to be back to add a star to my review.  If not, there are plenty of other sushi restaurants.
author: Earline A.

description: A sweet little place. Not many tables, but the sushi and fish that we had were very nice, a step up of your average sushi place.
author: Gal S.

description: A little confused about the 4-star average for this place. Food is decent, but for what you pay, you're way better off going elsewhere, especially considering that Sushi Zone and Sushi Time are both in the neighborhood and have way better sushi with a way more modest price tag.
author: K H.

description:
I loved this sushi place! I have been trying to find a good sushi restaurant in the city, and this one really impressed me. The volcano roll was really creative and fun. The rest of the sushi rolls were just as good.

I also love the service here. They substituted avocado for mango without question. They were also just really nice and friendly. We gave them a big tip. :)

I'll definitely be back.
author: Sarah A.

description: Beware! I work next door to this place and get to see the dirty cooks taking a break every 20 minutes to play scratchers. It seems like if they have time to take a break every 20 minutes that they could wash their hands. (take a shower before work too!) Not only has this place increased its prices steadily since open, I would never let cooks that look like that touch my food. Good luck with the tape worm.
author: Shaun A.

description: Try to come at least once weekly for lunch. Great lunch special. Hostess is always courteous. Great service.
author: John T.

description: We live in the area and this is our go-to weeknight sushi location. The nigiri are fresh (ask what the specials are) and quite tasty, and they also have excellent gyoza. They will let you take out the sushi (even deliver it if you are stuck at home), which is great if you are working or have kids already in bed. We have taken our daughter there for dinner and they are pretty tolerant of her "hands-on" approach to eating sushi rolls. Is it the best sushi in the city? Probably not. Would I rather go to Ebisu? Probably yes, but Takara is quite good and fresh and close to home. And unlike some of the other sushi places in the neighborhood, you don't have to worry about squeezing in, wondering if "cheap" is a good sushi criterion, or if you will have to wait an authentically long time for a table or your food.
author: Carrie G.

description: Solid Sushi. Just tried it with the wife for the first time tonight.  Had a great time, felt special and ordered some of the specials, fatty tuna was one as was the oysters, both were fantastic, though a bit pricy. The house rolls were awesome, the volcano roll blew us a way!  The nigiri and house rolls were all very good and above average, and for the location the price was not over the top.  The biggest con about this place was waiting too long to try it.  We will be back.
author: Mickey D.

description: This is my go to local Sushi joint! Is it the best Sushi ever? No. But is it high quality, affordable, possess a chill ambiance, and a friendly staff that remembers you? YES! If you are in the mood for some sushi, saki, and a Sapporo, this is a great spot to dine with your spouse on a week day date night, or slide up to bar and watch a ball game while enjoying your wasabi. Takara fulfills your sushi craving without breaking your wallet or making your feel like a tourist. You can't go wrong with the Aloha, SF, and Hurricane rolls. My only hope is that they put their front door on an automatic spring, so that when people arrive and depart, it is not always left ajar and drafty for the remaining diners.
author: Culinary C.

description: Great food, pleasantly surprised when we discovered it a while back, it's been our Goto for sushi since and when we're not cooking. Nigiri is usually fantastic and mouth watering, and love most of the rolls, our favorites: volcano, geisha, x-roll.
author: Gray K.

description: I have had many of their sushi rolls and it's always fresh every time. It's ideal for take out. The people are very friendly and extremely polite. They take care of their customers well.
author: Kelly Y.

description: went here on a friday evening a few weeks ago. no reservation but we were able to be seated after 15-20 min. food was ok but service wasnt all that great. it took a long time for someone to take our order. and it took even longer to get our food. The place was quite small i felt like i couldnt breath inside.  This is not the place to go if your just planning to eat and bounce out. i think its better for people who want to stay longer, drink with friends and chat and stay for 2-3 hours.
author: Steve S.

description:
one of the last and few restaurants that i haven't tried around the castro area. definitely, a place to try and get your japanese fix on!

first, the place is so small and pretty intimiate, i should say. nice restroom, may i say? you can always tell a place on what kind of restroom they have. just sayin.

2nd, the food wasn't disappointing, at all! got me (and my girlie friend) some baked mussels---garlic-y and cheesy, tempura udon--comforting!, tokyo breeze--light and breezy sushi, REAL california roll---which had a REAL crab. overall, it was such a comforting dinner on a cold, SF night.

3rd, my girlie friend was happy enough to say that..they were playing authentic japanese pop music. AWESOMENESS! 

a worthwhile to visit all over over over.....A G A I N! ^_^
author: Marc K.

description:
EXCELLENT!! 

They always remember me when I come in and even my order. I seriously asked them a month later: "what was the roll my friend got who was allergic to dairy?"  They remembered! One hand almost creepy, on the other I can't judge them rudely  if they are that smart and attentive. Extremely friendly and will almost run to your table to remove your straw wrapper when you set it down. I was at Costco in my "get-me-the-fuck-out-of-this-line-so-I-can-sit-and-enjoy-my-hot-dog-daze when one of the waiters came up to me and said hi and asked me how I was off the clock!! Excellence is excellent and the staff is very humble and its heartwarming. I feel as though this place is ran in such a way that they are proud to be open and running. You have got to see their bathroom sink too its HELLA cool!!!! The tsunami roll is very tasty and the last thing I will say is that this place is not run like a Mc donalds where you are treated like an insignificant number like Osaka Sushi is.
author: Mike R.

description: Amazing sushi with great service. Always a favorite. Their specials have never dissapointed. Spicy Geisha!!
author: Roberto G.

description: I've dined at this restaurant on a number of occasions since it first opened in my neighborhood.  I think the entrees (i.e. miso glazed seabass) and sushi are great.  Prices are slightly higher than a few other places in the neighborhood but I think the food is better at Takara than the other few in the vicinity.  The service is generally pretty good but I remember one occasion when the waitress was a little pushy with us ordering alcohol and was ready to clear the table the instant we finished our food, which seemed to be a bit rushed even though we ordered what I thought to be a lot of food.  Anyway, I've been back since that experience and all was ok.
author: Kent W.

description: Nice place, great food, great service!!  We had a really good time, thanks in part to our server Betty.  She was really fun.  Miso soup with clams was delicious and an unusual offering.  Sushi presentations were beautiful.  Fresh wasabi - we couldn't get enough!  Freshest, crispiest tempura ever!!  Try the pumpkin roll - spicy scallop with succulent salmon wrapped around; or the Japonese with the crunchy cracker base.  Love the dark wood decor, gave the place a high-end feel.  The staff were very helpful with the birthday cake we brought.  Thanks Takara!
author: Teresa S.

description: excellent sushi - friendly service - can get super busy - my favorite is the SF roll - delicious!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Yummy neighborhood sushi joint 2 blocks away from me, what more could I ask for! I've eaten here about 4x now, and I've enjoyed every meal! 

Sashimi is always fresh, and they have a pretty good selection of food options to choose from. Here are some of the items I've had:
- Volcano Roll (5 stars): Eel/mango/tuna/salmon with some crispy flakes. Yum! Doesn't look like a traditional roll, but under all the crispy flakes, you'll find the delicious pieces of sushi, don't worry.
- Summer Roll (3.5 stars): A bit plain, but I like it when I'm trying to go for something simple and lighter since it's wrapped with soy paper and doesn't have any extravagant sauces on it.
- Dinosaur Roll (4 stars): Soft-shell crab goodness! Sometimes the soft shell crab is prepared better than others, but overall a solid roll.
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll (5 stars): Good tuna with a perfect amount of spiciness.
- Eggplant Special (5 stars): Super delicious combo of scallop/eggplant/shrimp! Spicy miso sauce gives each bite a nice kick.
- Tempura Udon (2 stars): I got this via delivery since I was craving noodles so might not be a right indicator of the actual dish. But it didn't taste like anything special, and I would've liked a better assortment of tempura.
- Salmon sashimi appetizer (4 stars): Very smooth, but I usually let the bf eat all of this since it's his fave type of sashimi.

Additional pluses: I've never had to wait for a seat, and the prices are decent (prob can get out of here paying between $15-20/person). The restaurant provides free edamame beans before your meal (love it because I always feel cheated when places try to sell me a tiny plate of edamame for $5), and the waiters are super attentive in refilling tea. Seriously, I don't think my tea cup has ever gone empty... they definitely have some magic tea radar up in here.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Been here a few times now. Convenient location in the heart of the Castro. Price/quality-wise, you get the same quality as you would get in most other places in SF for the same price (i.e. expect to pay $20+/person).  Normally I'm a nigiri kind of guy, but I will say that Takara's volcano roll was amazing.  The wait isn't too bad and the wait staff is really nice.  Also, if I had to give a tip, check this place out during lunch for their lunch deals! :)
author: Ben T.

description: Great value for lunch. Not the best sushi in town but really affordable. Miso soup was fantastic.
author: Frank L.

description:
we did a mini pre-bday celebration here with another couple and was presently suprised at the food.  this place is run by chinese people but the food is good.  i want to come back and try more of the nigiri and sashimi.  

we had some rolls:  crazy, salmon lover, and another one i cant remember the name of.  all of them were good!  we also ordered hamachi kama which was huge!  and also the miso seabass that came with 3 or 4? pieces! it was a lot of food.

i thought service was excellent as they kept coming by to check up and refill our teas and water.

parking in this neighborhood can be difficult though
author: claudia y.

description:
Was craving sushi but didn't feel like waiting for a table so tried delivery from here.  Worst experience ever.  Took multiple calls to the restaurant and 2 hours before my food finally arrived!!  Food was so-so cause it had been in the delivery driver's car for over an hour!!

All I can say is don't bother with delivery from here.
author: Jay C.

description: Great variety and have had much of it! They consistently deliver quality and tasty sushi. Plus that they have Chardonnay :-) Very friendly service and cool environment - from the window views to the TVs with sports playing. Frankly, one of the best placed to watch a game in the Castro too.
author: Addy K.

description: As promised, we continue to enjoy Takara once a week.  Usually at home (they deliver on grub hub.com) but from time to time, we brave the 3 block walk and dine in.  Our original confused service experience was definitely an aberration - we've had nothing but excellent service every time we've been back.  They even started carrying tamari (gluten free soy) because we had asked for it a couple of times!  Now THAT is excellent client service.
author: Natalie N.

description: I love going here for lunch. Friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Great sushi.
author: Len M.

description:
This is my favorite Japanese Restaurant so far. I like how all the dishes have really good presentation. They look like food that would cost a lot more than it actually does. They are not stingy about the Uni and other expensive seafood are used in the sushi. The seafood are super fresh all the time. You could tell by eating them without any sauce.  They still taste sweet.  The most important thing is the creative ideas and unique combination of the food in this restaurant. I have been so disappointed with all other Japanese restaurants in Bay area. 

 If I am paying the money to eat at a restaurant, I am not just expecting to eat rolls, noodles and teriyaki chicken or a simple smoke salmon rice dish. Right, they do tastes good and are very filling but these are the cheapest food which don't require fresh seafood and expensive ingredients.   You can easy make these at home and get pretty decent rolls from Safeway.  Why not save your money?   Everything with the japanese Mayo which has lots of MSG, and Unagi (the preservative eel) will never taste bad.  If I am paying to eat at a restaurant, I am looking for fresh seafood and special food.  If you want to try Japanese food at a different level, i highly recommend Takara Sushi.
author: Angel Y.

description: A pleasant surprise indeed! If you are visiting the Castro Its worth a short walk down 18th. The food is DELICIOUS! Try the volcano roll WOW! Friendly service and a nice vibe, very cute!
author: Jake T.

description:
Takara falls short from my favorite Japanese restaurant, which name shall be kept disclosed within this entry. Now I'm not saying Takara was bad, but it just didn't quite match up to my expectations. 

Takara kinda reminds me of your girlfriend's hot younger sister. She's banging. She dresses better. She's spunky and has a bubbly outgoing personality. You like everything about her... physically. But at the end of the day, you'd rather go back to your girlfriend because you realize she's way more amazing than this spunkier new thang. Not only does she provide more sustenance, but younger sister just doesn't quite have that "je ne sais quoi" that you're so crazy about and have been accustomed to for the past 3 years. And that's basically how I felt about Takara. The interior was banging. It definitely was trendier than my favorite Japanese spot, not to mention their sleek and modern looking bathroom. I must've spent 20 minutes in there not because of bodily malfunctions, rather because it was so chic with it's dim lights, slow flowing facet and dark granite walls. Talk about total sophistication! 

However when it was time to eat, that definitely was a different story. Sustenance lacked. I'm crazy about cheesy tonkatsu, however theirs didn't quite have that oozy gooey cheesy perfection that cheesy tonkatsu should have. Rather they skimped on the cheese, leaving my tonkatsu shameful. I also ordered "The Bomb," which definitely was a bomb of crap in my mouth. The flavors of the different fish and sauces just didn't quite compliment each other. The excess raw fish laid on top of the roll along with a clump of mystery sauce felt like a pile of mush in my mouth. However, despite the dissatisfaction I felt towards the plates I ordered, I did enjoy pieces from my lover's bento box, so I'm not 100% completely mad at Takara. I will only venture back at Takara if it's not upon my behalf, other than that, back to my favorite Japanese spot.
author: Ally C.

description: Great bastardized American Sushi. We loved it. Six of us went at Happy Hour on a Wednesday (every weekday except Friday 4-6), ordered a bunch of random rolls and enjoyed all of them. watch out for The Bomb, and the Firecracker.
author: William C.

description: The yummy roll and Tokyo breeze rolls were excellent, and I'm so happy to find a place that serves great escolar sashimi.
author: Chris N.

description: Finally a decent Sushi place in the Castro! The staff are friendly, the rolls are unique and just plain good. Been there about four times now and its proven consistent. There is no long wait, its casual and reasonably priced (well for Sushi)
author: Jason P.

description:
So, I ordered food from Takara Sushi through www.eat24hours.com 
45 minutes later, which was predicted the delivery guy rang my bell about 15 times on a row.  I pay and he leaves.  I open the bag and there was no soy sauce and chop sticks!!!    From there, I called and she said she would ask the driver to return to my house and deliver the goods.  In the mean time I had order a hamachi carpaccio, took the fish eggs and jalapeno slice from it, (as I don't like both and it was not specified in the menu) eat a slab and my mouth instantly start burning like never before... 
2 cups of milk later, I call Takara and explain the situation , so I asked to have a beef Tataki NOT spicy instead. So she told the driver would come by but I need to give him the unwanted food which was fine with me.  
As of right now 1 and half hour later no sign of the driver....
Seriously, worst experience ever!!!!!
author: Michelle S.

description: Love the variety of rolls! The servers were prompt and attentive. Free refills on hot tea and delicious appetizers. I highly recommend the eggplant special.
author: Sarah W.

description: We got delivery of several basic sushi rolls and they were about as good as Whole Foods prepacked sushi.
author: John S.

description: Sushi is fresh and the service is always excellant!!! They have really unique rolls and the sashimi is always mouth watering! My favorite ..the volcano roll and salmon sashimi!!!
author: Jennie M.

description: My partner and I LOVE sushi and have lived in NYC and SF. Takara is by far our favorite place. Not only is the food so delicous but the staff is so much fun. They always seem so happy to see us and offer great suggestions on what to get. Make sure if you go to order the shrimp appetizer with the spicy cream sauce.. dancing shrimp maybe? it is amazing! We love TAKARA!!
author: Scott L.

description: Try the Octopus Sake Bomb. It really is the bomb! :) Expensive but exquisite Sushi. My friend and I go there about once a month. Love it!
author: N C.

description: Great unpretentious sushi place.  Fresh fish, tasting ingredients, nice plating.  What else do you want?  Oh and reasonable prices.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Long Long LONG wait for *RAW* sushi. After placing our order at 8:10pm for 2 ppl, we received one california roll at 8:30 and the remaining 4 rolls more than 15 mins later after complaining to the waitress. My partner had to ask for a complimentary bowl of miso soup (otherwise $3). Needless to say, we missed the July 4th fireworks show.

Would I eat here again? Absolutely not. Especially not when you're in a rush.

Water refills are very timely though.
author: J. R.

description: Takara is the best sushi place in the castro!  And Betty - one of the servers is super friendly and helpful.  We go here all the time especially for the lunch specials and happy hour.  This is high quality stuff you will not be disappointed.
author: Sonia V.

description: The seared tuna appetizer is seriously addictive.  We LOVE Betty and Justine!!  Always a fun atmosphere... best sushi in the Castro for sure!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Avocado: Brown. Crab: Imitation. Sushi: strange aftertaste. Teriyaki Beef: Tough and Gristly, covered in sauce. The service was welcoming and attentive. Try Miyabi.
author: Chris W.

description:
I had higher hopes for this place, but you can tell they are just opening up.  I hope they figure things out because the staff seemed like very nice people. 

The evening started with the host confused about where we should sit.  After looking at his watch and glancing at his supervisor, he moved us to the other side of the restaurant; no big.  

We ordered a King California roll, two spider hand rolls, a spicy tuna hand roll, two bowls of miso, and two glasses of water.  The crab in the King California roll had a strange texture and didn't taste that great.  The spicy tuna hand roll came 10 minutes after the first part of the meal.  We thought they forgot it, and when it came it had too much batter to actually taste anything.  The spicy tuna roll was ok.  The miso was good.  Finally, the water never came :(. 

The overall experience was awkward at best.  The interior of the restaurant is nice, through it seemed a bit too rigid.  The wait staff seemed to have no clue what was going on.  After the lead wait staff person asked how our evening went, I explained the issues.  If anything, I hope they can improve.  It has the potential to be a cool place to eat, but they need to improve some things.  I ended up eatting only one of the pieces of sushi and a bit of the spider roll to taste it;  I am still hungry.  Two stars for now, but I will try again in a couple of months if the restaurant lasts. 

The positives: free green tea (yummie), free edamame (it was warm but good), and the bathroom was very clean.  

The best part is the host delivered our check with a quiet "I am so sorry."  

Best of luck to your new business.
author: Brian S.

description: Had great fresh tasting sushi here.  Service is scattered but fine if your not in a hurry.
author: Vincent C.

description: Got delivery from here last night. No significant problems with that, although we definitely had to supplement the meager soy sauce supply. And their sushi tasted yummy, sure. Not the best I've ever had, but good. However, their portion sizes are ridiculously small! Like, tiniest rolls I've ever seen. We will never order from here again.
author: Laura H.

description: Takara has some of the freshest rolls I have ever tasted! Their Volcano roll and Spicy geisha roll were amazing! Their flavors are unbelievable and their service is excellent! I will definitely be back!
author: Arieana G.

description:
I really shouldn't complain, but for full disclosure, the *free* tea was weak, and the *free* edamame to start was cold.

The red dragon roll was delicious and well presented, the extra orders of salmon nagiri were quick to come out and offered plenty of fresh salmon.

The staff was friendly, and they kept the water filled.
author: Mike W.

description: The sushi had no taste, the crab in the California roll tasted off, overall a waste of money. Even the edamame were undercooked and inedible. I'm giving them two two stars only because after calling to complain they refunded the money which was very reasonable of them.
author: J Z.

description:
My boyfriend and I had been looking for a reasonably priced place in the city that had good sushi and Japanese food. We were just about to give up when Takara opened down the street from us. We had gone once a week every week since they opened. Then we moved to a different neighborhood. Since the move we have been back every other week. 

The best thing on the menu is the Spicy Dancing Shrimp. It is a little hot for me but I love it anyways ((I'm a wimp when it comes to spice). 

The fish is always fresh, their specials always good and if you just don't like sushi (like my boyfriend) then there is always something different to try. My boyfriend and I try to order something different each time we go but we also have our favorite stand-bys that we order along with the new things. 

Sitting at the bar is nice and the chefs are very friendly, the owners are wonderful and we have never had a bad time there. 

We have brought many friends there who are now going all the time on their own and bringing new people in as customers. 

The only thing I hate about writing a review for this place is that we will not be able to get a table next time we go.
author: S G.

description: Spicy Geisha roll was SO GOOD. My partner had a tempura udon bowl that was ho hum, but I would definitely go back for the sushi. Great service.
author: Lauren C.

description: Had a late dinner after a show with about 9 people and they were really great about getting us set up at a large table. Was also impressed with how they made suggestions on how we should order as a group and brought our food out in courses nicely paced and always divided in plates for both ends of the table, explaining what each dish was as it came out. The sushi was really good, would definitely go back. Only down side, it did take a little while to get our order in and the place was freezing cold, but that wouldn't stop me from coming back for some really good sushi. It's pretty fairly priced, not cheap but not over priced either.
author: Jenelle H.

description:
sashimi is super fresh there, my tai literally melted in my mouth. all others that i tried (uni, amaebi, salmon) were also very good (in taste and display). volcano roll and their seasoned edamame made the best appetizers. prices are reasonable for the quality, every penny worth! the owner and the people working at the sushi bar are also very friendly. 

this place is really for people that enjoy sushi. while there are many options where i can pay less for so-so rolls that can stuff my stomach, i would always come back for sushi.   

i think this place is even better than sushi ota in sd.
author: Michie Y.

description: Reasonably priced, very solid sushi place in the castro. Excellent service.
author: E T.

description: The waitresses there are really really nice and friendly and gave me tips of searching for housing in SF. Among the food I tried the spice scallop sushi is really gorgeous!
author: Shirley W.

description: Great sushi, great service, and a pretty good value (especially compared to Barracuda Sushi nearby in the Castro on Market).  They also have super fast and accurate delivery.  The waitresses always remember us when we come in and are always extremely friendly.  Definitely some of the best sushi in the area.  I always pick here and Domo in Hayes Valley when I want my sushi fill.
author: M H.

description: Fabulous!   Lived in SF for a decade and this is easily my favorite sushi place.  The fish is delicious, the staff is attentive and friendly, and the restaurant has a neighborhood feel.
author: Adam C.

description:
There are three things I look for in sushi: perfect rice, fresh fish, slices that are decently sized and sensitively shaped.  In this regard, Takara is a failure. Sadly, for I like the neighborhood (it's mine), and the sitting space has its own funky charms. Details?  The rice was old, flavorless, clumpy and dry; it should have been moist with evenly cooked grains gently sticking to each other.  The  fish itself was half fresh, half a bit leathery and quite dull looking.  Worse was the slicing, which was amateurish: The fish came out chunky and uneven and in one case butchered (parts of a white fish were dangling like broken limbs). As my dinner companion noted, the preparation was "disrespectful to the fish."(For another day--can I be respectful to fish and eat them at the same time?)   Adding to the disappointment was the miso, which had little flavor except for an inauthentic bitterness. Was it powdered miso? And the bowl that it was served were beaten, cheap and scary.


Why then didn't I give the place one star?  Well, some of the sushi pieces were fresh and the sizes were generous. Also I was there on a rainy night so I got warm sake for a buck. Even for mediocre sake, you can't beat that.

Added note: I often to to a restaurant believing yelp reviewers who tossed around, no doubt too casually, the word 'great."  There as nothing great here, but it leads me to wonder what  leads them to write that way. Please give more detail--I note that in the least favorable reviews, the writers gave more detail.  Word count=relevance? Just asking.
author: Pan K.

description: this  place is  delish and a nice change for the area to have a new upscale place and a great place for dates in the castro..its only beer and wine which is fine with the onslaught of discount drinks you can get a stones throw away..service is impeccable,fish very fresh go one give it a try.....
author: wilma m.

description: My favorite sushi restaurant in my neighborhood.  The sushi is always fresh, and the wait-staff is super friendly.  Make sure you try the volcano roll!
author: Andrew W.

description: First, let me acknowledge that it really pains me to post this one star review.  While you can't swing a dead cat around the Castro without hitting a crazy queer or two (don't be offended, I'm one myself), all the swinging pussy in the world won't hit a truly good sushi joint here.  Nevertheless, Takara was a welcome addition to the neighborhood since it's rolls make the competition look (and taste) like cat food.  However, after my experience tonight, I can post nothing else.  This party of one (my, myself & ...) drop in for a quick spicy tuna roll & a Sapporo before I head home to be domestic.  I ordered & waited.  ...  After about 5 minutes 2 guys sit at the table next to me & order a few rolls (including a spicy tuna roll).  I know this not because I'm an eavesdropping weirdo, but because the tables are close together.  (The rating has nothing to do with this, as it actually adds to the charm of the atmosphere of this small but cute establishment).  So, long story short, my roll goes to the other guys.  It's written on my server's face that she knows this (and the fact that she is telling the chef to make a spicy tuna roll very quickly kind of gives it away too).  Nonetheless, instead of just coming over to explain what happened, she avoids me trying to buy time.  Eventually I became fed up with waiting more than 20 mins for a spicy tuna roll (especially as I was watching someone else eat my roll).  So, I canceled my roll, paid for the beer and bounced. I'll give them one more chance down the road (everyone has an off day), but for now I just can't recommend.
author: Doug V.

description: Based on the the high ratings, I thought I would give this place a try last night.  I really can't say I enjoyed myself or the food.  All of the menu items are overpriced especially for the meager portions one receives.  Also, the sake is WAY overpriced and is the middle of the road Sake that is advertised as high quality.  The sushi is NOT FRESH.  With other options in the neighborhood, I recommend going to other Sushi establishments.
author: E E.

description: Good fresh sushi. Friendly staff. They have really fresh fish. Didn't eat any rolls since they looked a bit overcomplicated.  Service definitely a bit scattered but very very friendly.  I'd go back.
author: Alex Y.

description: Shared four delicious rolls. The Volcano Roll and the Tokyo Breeze (or something) were delicious and very interesting. Service was quick and incredibly friendly. Portions were average to on the small side, so don't go here if you're very hungry and/or on a very tight budget!
author: Geoffrey U.

description: My favorite here is the Takara Special sushi sashimi combo. It comes with four pieces of sashimi and four niguiri, but today the 4 pc of sashimi look like two regular pieces cut in to four, making them very small; really bad business, then when I told them this wasn't okay I didn't get any excuse or apology, not even a gesture they'll make it better. Guess what, this is the fourth time I go there and the last time also.
author: E M.

description: One BIG problem. Two words: tiny portions. I believe the restaurant is making a mistake by serving such small portions at expensive prices. Our order of asparagus was literally four stalks cut in half to create 8 pieces of rather average tasting grilled asparagus. The gyoza were a normal sized portion, but alas, they weren't very good-- a bit dry, lacking in fresh pork flavor, and no sesame oil. The rolls were also average in taste and VERY tiny. The one thing that was outstanding at Takara was the quality of the sashimi. Excellent! But unfortunately, the fish was sliced incredibly thin and you are served only four of the thin pieces per $10 order. It's really too bad because they DELIVER as well! I'd love to have a good sushi restaurant that delivered, but you'll go broke trying to put together a normal meal at Takara, whether you're dining in or ordering out.
author: Stephen P.

description: a long wait for bad sushi....  even in the castro, there are better places.
author: Kevin W.
